Merge pull request #1458 from sproutcore/team/mauritslamers/recordarray_local_update

Trigger observers whenever a record array changes

Trigger observers whenever a record array changes

When a record array is empty because the backing query is still
in flight, setting the record array as content of an array controller
will cause the status to become READY_CLEAN despite the query being
in flight, as it doesn't find any records in the store. When the
store indicates it has fetched the query, the status will stay
READY_CLEAN and observers late to the chase (such as stateObservers)
will not be notified when the data comes in. Calling the
this.notifyPropertyDidChange() for the status causes these
observers to be fired.

jQuery fail to compute the correct offset when using $.position.
This is because, in SC, centered elements are positioned in percentage
like this: top: 50%; margin-top: -10px. And jQuery is subtracting the
margin from the offset which lead to a wrong value.
This commit fixe this and remove some hacky code in
positionOverTargetView which was related to this behaviour. This hack
were causing trouble when an SC.InlineTextFieldView were displayed from
an element positioned without percentage (like in SC.TableView).

The `SC.guidFor()` method (primarily used internally) no longer maintains a cache for String and Number GUIDs. Because the GUID for a String or a Number is essentially its own value, the caching process actually takes longer than it does to simply generate a GUID key from the given String or Number (see http://jsperf.com/cache-vs-manipulate). More importantly, this removes the memory overhead of maintaining the GUID cache, which was also unable to be cleaned.

Also removed the completely unused _guidPrefixes, _numberGuids and _stringGuids objects.

The `hasObserverFor` method of `SC.Observable` has been improved to also be able to optionally check against a specific target and method. This allows the developer to properly check for the existence of a specific handler before adding it rather than only being able to check for the existence of any handler (without knowing which handler it is).
Adds (nearly complete) support to hasObserverFor for per-observer checking.
Added tiny comment note for future reference.

The `owner` property of SC.View has been deprecated for general use. This property is identical to the existing `parentView` property on all views. It existed in order for some ancestor view to claim ownership of a descendent view, so that the descendent could reference the ancestor directly as `owner` rather than using some chain like `parentView.parentView...`. However, this type of connection can still be achieved by the an ancestor simply assigning `owner`, or whichever property they want to use, none-the-less and there's no need for every single SC.View to have it assigned.

Fixes a couple inconsistencies in View statechart. In particular, adopting an ATTACHED_BUILDING_OUT view failed to work and no longer attempting to reverse transitions.

After some investigation, it was found that there were a number of issues with the built-in gesture support. For example, two touch taps would throw an exception, pinches would fail to register and in particular, supporting multiple gestures failed in a number of scenarios. In order to fix these problems, the gesture code has been rewritten from the top-down.

It is now possible to mixin SC.Gesturable to a view and use events to react to multiple gestures concurrently. Examples of the advanced type of behavior that the gesture code allows include:

* Responding to single finger, two finger or any other number of touch taps, pinches (2+ touches) or swipes individually or as a group. For example, your code may want to perform different actions when a single finger taps vs. when there is a two finger tap.
* A touch session, the time between when the first touch begins and the last touch ends, may contain more than one gesture. For example, it's possible for the user to perform a pinch, then use a third finger to tap, then swipe the remaining fingers. For example, imagine using pinch to scale an image, tap to save the change and then swipe to move it aside all without lifting the fingers. At the least, the ability to perform gestures in a single touch session multiple times, makes the gesture recognition more robust against stray accidental touches.
* Swipe gestures can now be configured to match against any arbitrary angles, not just left, right, up & down.
* Swipe gestures no longer trigger by simply moving far enough in one direction. They must also move quickly (configurable) and end immediately.

Moved the average touch code out of SC.RootResponder and made it a class method of SC.Touch (SC.Touch.averagedTouch()). This makes it possible to use the functionality to average touches without needing to run through the root responder code.

Improves the designMode support for layouts to only reset layouts to the overridden value using explicit layouts. This avoids overwriting the entire layout when the design mode changes.

Includes the legacy framework for testing desktop framework.

There is now a sub-framework within SproutCore, `:'sproutcore/legacy'`, which is meant to contain all code providing support for older browsers. This includes the existing polyfill for `window.requestAnimationFrame` and a brand new polyfill for `Object.keys`. The legacy framework is included by default by requiring `:sproutcore` in a project's or an app's Buildfile. The legacy framework itself requires the `:sproutcore/desktop` framework, which allows for any legacy code in the SproutCore controls to be separated out.

Therefore, to build an app that will only work with the newest browsers (probably not a great idea —), you may change your Buildfile requirements to include only the specific SproutCore sub-frameworks you need. For example,

    config :my_app, :required => [:"sproutcore/desktop", :"sproutcore/datastore"]

SC.PickerPane has been given special behavior when used with SC.View's `transitionIn` plugin support. If the plugin defines `layoutProperties` of either `scale` or `rotate`, then the picker will adjust its transform origin X & Y position to appear to scale or rotate out of the anchor. The result is a very nice effect that picker panes appear to pop out of their anchors.

Also fixed an infinite loop issue with using transitions that effected the size of the pane. Closes #1213

Closes #1205

Refactors view statechart some more to fix regressions and improve handling of transition state conflicts. No longer notifies all descendents if a view's visibility changes (i.e. willHideInDocument/willShowInDocument are only called on views when their own isVisible property is set).
Fixed a regression in SC._BindableSpan.
White space tidies.

Fixed an issue that could occur when using temporary IDs with newly created records. Because the `id` property is a computed property, once it has been read (i.e. `myNewRecord.get('id')`), it will remain cached for any further reads. This can become an issue in situations where the ID of the record changes after being saved to the server. For instance, a new record may be given a temporary ID when it is created and the temporary id may be accessed via `get`. After that record is saved to the server, a call to `store.dataSourceDidComplete(RecordType, newBody, newBody.id)` would properly update the `id` value in the store, but would fail to clear the record instance's cache of `id`. Therefore, a successive call to `get('id')` would return the old value.
Tidies some unit tests a bit.

Fixed possible issues that may occur when code altered child views in any of the view state callback functions: `didCreateLayer`, `didAppendToDocument`, `didHideInDocument`, `didShowInDocument`. The issue was that the callback functions were called on the parent before the child was updated to the proper new state. For example, if a developer set the visibility of a child view to false in `didCreateLayer`, at that point the child view would have still been in an unrendered state and optimizations preventing visibility changes to unrendered views would have meant the visibility change would have been lost.

Refactored the view statechart code significantly to improve the clarity of the state transition handling and fixes #1269.

Modifies the private SC.View _callOnChildViews method to accept an isTopDown variable in order to determine if the method should be called from the top down or from the bottom up. Certain calls need to be made from the bottom up, which wasn't previously possible.

There are two new binding transforms, `string` and `integer`, that ensure the value is *always* a `String` or an integer `Number`. Examples include returning an empty `String` for `null` or `undefined` values when using the `string` transform and returning a 0 for these same values when using the `integer` transform. Furthermore, if the `integer` transform is given a String, it will be parsed to an integer `Number` according to the extra argument `radix` (which is 10 by default).

There is a new binding transform, `mix`, that allows for the aggregation of multiple bound properties into a single property through a given function. It is often the case that a single property depends on two or more bound properties in a complex manner that isn't handled by the current `and` and `or` transforms. To handle this situation previously, the developer would need to write the code to bind in the external property values and then make a local computed property dependent on each of these. The `mix` transform does exactly the same thing, but with less typing on the developer's part.

* Cleaned up the code and removed some memory leaks (undeclared variables).

SC.Binding - Adds a transform that aggregates through a function the values at given paths.
SC.Binding and + or transform: accept an unlimited number of paths
SC.Binding.mix - move the aggregate function to the end of the arguments list. The binding will be created using something like SC.Binding.mix( "path1", "path2", "path3", function() )

Fixed an issue with observing the `selection` property of `SC.TextFieldView`. Since the `input` element doesn't update its `selectionStart` and `selectionEnd` values until after the event execution completes, the mouse and keypress event handlers that affect the selection must wait until after the run loop before notifying that the selection property has changed.

Improves the double click rejection handling from previous change in SC.RootResponder. It checks the SC.View handler rather than the evt.target, because some views like SC.ListItemView replace their layer on update, so a double click would fail even though it's the same target view instance.

`SC.RootResponder` mistook two successive mousedown events at the same point as a double click even if the target of the second mousedown was different. The result was that if a view moved suddenly on a first click, a second immediate click at the same point would try to call `doubleClick` on the new target view instead of just `mouseUp`.

SC.ScrollView alignment handling has been improved for container (i.e. the scroll view) or content size changes. This change partially addresses a regression that allowed the content to appear offset incorrectly when it or the scroll view's size changed. But after some investigation, the behavior has also been improved to support the following scenarios:

1. The scroll view is left (or top) aligned, scrolled to the maximum right (or bottom) edge and container or content changes size: the content should stick to the right (or bottom) side
2. The scroll view is left (or top) aligned, scrolled to the minimum left (or top) edge and container or content changes size: the content should stick to the left (or top) side
3. The scroll view is right (or bottom) aligned, scrolled to the maximum right (or bottom) edge and container or content changes size: the content should stick to the right (or bottom) side
4. The scroll view is right (or bottom) aligned, scrolled to the minimum left (or top) edge and container or content changes size: the content should stick to the left (or top) side
5. The scroll view is center (or middle) aligned, scrolled to the center (or middle) and container or content changes size: the content should stick to the center (or middle)

Refactored SC.Event slightly. Most importantly, SC.Event instances are now cached per event type in order to avoid constant memory re-allocation. Previously, every DOM event was normalized into a new SC.Event object, which was later freed. In order to reduce the amount of memory churn, one SC.Event instance is cached per type of event and updated with the new DOM event as it comes in.

Fixed a very slow memory leak in SC.browser. Caching of the experimental style names for the current browser would fail intermittently since the cache key was being kept on the CSSStyleDeclaration which the browser (seen in Chrome) would occasionally drop. Caching is now done per experimental style name, which is more correct and has the added benefit of being marginally faster than using SC.guidFor.
Fixes regression in enhance() extension from optimization.
Optimizes `arguments` access within enhance extension and invoke_superclass_method.
Fixes regression in SC.DelegateSupport from optimization.
Fixes regression in SC.Module from optimization.

Fixes regression in SC.WebSocket from optimization.
Fixes regression in SC.Request from optimization.
Fixes regression in SC.Color from optimization.
Moved all of SC.Module's debugging log code into debug-only.
Tidies code a bit for readability.

Removes declared but unused variables.
Automatic whitespace removal.

Removed long deprecated method, `SC.browser.compareVersion`. This method was deprecated in version 1.7 and is not used anywhere within the framework. As the deprecation warning noted, developers should use the `SC.browser.compare` method for doing a proper comparison between version strings.

Optimized use of the `arguments` object in several locations in order to avoid its instantiation. There were several occurrences of code copying the `arguments` object into an Array using `slice`; this is very costly for performance as it causes the browser to instantiate the `arguments` object in order to do the slice. Instead, these occurrences were converted to either access the arguments by index without a copy or to do a fast copy without instantiation. See http://jsperf.com/closure-with-arguments for an example of the performance difference this can make. Using slice is anywhere from ~50% to ~90% slower depending on the browser.

Affected: SC.Request, SC.WebSocket, SC.DelegateSupport, SC.Color, SC.Event, SC.Store, SC.Module, SC.Object, SC.Function, SC.State, SC.Statechart
Fixes regression from shared layout style object. Moved shared layout style object to the view instance where it should be.

* The core methods used in SC.View layout have been slightly optimized to avoid memory re-allocation. Since SC.View layout code may run repeatedly in short order (e.g. re-positioning during scrolling), we need to ensure that no new objects are created each time. The reason for this is so that we're not quickly adding hundreds of small objects to the garbage heap that will need to be collected. Since we have no control over when garbage collection occurs, the best we can do is try to avoid it and to ensure that it completes as quickly as possible.
Automatic whitespace removal.
Adds a unit test which shows a deficiency in SC.RootResponder's sendAction. It failed to pass the context to the target (This was fixed two commits earlier).

* The argument for the SC.ActionSupport mixin's main method `fireAction` has been changed from `action` to `context`. This allows calling-time specific information to be passed to the action + target on each call. To specify the `action` for `fireAction` to use, the existing `action` property should still be set. As part of this change, the documentation for SC.ActionSupport has been greatly extended and includes tips on supporting multiple actions or targets and for implementing actions on targets.

Along with this change, the `actionContext` property has also now been deprecated and will be removed in a future version of SproutCore.

Note: this is a backwards-compatible change. If a String is passed to `fireAction` *and* no `action` property exists, the argument will be used as the `action` (i.e. no context will be sent). When this occurs, a Developer Warning will appear in the console. Likewise, a Developer Warning will appear if `actionContext` is set prior to a view being initialized.
* SC.ButtonView and SC.CollectionView have both been altered slightly to use SC.ActionSupport. This has no affect on the use of action & target in these views.

Removes an extra call to SC.RootResponder's computeWindowSize() each time that a pane is appended. This is unnecessary, since the root responder recomputes its window size property whenever the window actually resizes.

Fixes SC.MenuPane automatic resizing to fit within the window. The positioning code used in SC.PickerPane failed to apply adjustments to the width or height of the pane, which had been calculated to fit long menus within the window. Also improves the menu positioning code to respect the value of windowPadding (previously it used hard coded secret numbers within the code).

Refactors SC.PickerPane variable names. They were pre-minified, which makes the code hard to work with.

Changes SC.MenuItemView handling of submenus. Previously if the item's submenu was visible and the mouse exited back onto the menu item view, it tried to re-append the same submenu. Instead, it now checks to see if its submenu is already attached before attempting to enter it again.

Deprecates calculatedHeight and calculatedWidth. SC.ScrollView has to observe the content's frame anyway and so it's better to have just the frame observer in the scroll view be intelligent about what triggers an update (size not position) and save two extra observers in scroll views.
Refactors SC.ScrollView.
Allows for optimization of SC.RenderContext's setStyle method (Removes V8 "ForIn is not fast case" warning, see http://commondatastorage.googleapis.com/io-2013/presentations/223.pdf).
Tidies.
Adds a bit more testing to mouse handling in SC.CollectionView.

Improves performance of core SC methods: SC.mixin, SC.supplement as well as SC.Function.enhance. SC.mixin and SC.supplement iterated the arguments object to insert a boolean flag to pass to a private function that then iterated its arguments in order to ignore the flag argument, which is totally unnecessary. Instead, SC.mixin and SC.supplement iterate the arguments once and pass the new Array to the private function as a second argument, removing the need for a second iteration.

As well, these three areas all accessed the arguments object to copy it, which requires the browser to instantiate it, which is costly. Instead, we now do a fast copy (similar to this: http://jsperf.com/closure-with-arguments) without instantiating the arguments object.

Finally, by doing a fast copy of arguments these functions are now optimizable by V8, whereas they weren't previously.

Benchmark: SC.mixin & SC.supplement ~ 58% faster
Tidies code a bit a la jshint.
Adds additional unit tests for actOnSelect scenarios.

Calls adjustLayout on initialization of SC.CollectionView.

Certain containing views, transitions and specialized layout engines need to know what type of layout their child views will have in order to make the proper adjustments. SC.CollectionView subclasses typically set a width or a height themselves, but when this happens late, the actual layout style of the collection is misunderstood at initialization to be something different.

Captures mousewheel events while the mouse is pressed or just pressed (within 150ms). When a user clicks a mouse like the Apple Magic Mouse, they often involuntarily trigger a couple mousewheel events while pressing or lifting their finger. The result of this is that any scrolling views that act on the mousewheel event will move the content slightly (e.g. Ever notice how Google maps is basically unusable with an Apple Magic Mouse because every click zooms sporadically?). To prevent this, SC.CollectionView claims mousewheel events when it is also handling the mousedown event. As well, for a very brief moment after the mouse is released (and the user's finger is still traveling upward), the view continues to claim mousewheel events.

This change also refactors the mouseDown and mouseUp methods to have a single return (thus greatly reducing their complexity) and fixes an inconsistency in which `actOnSelect` only worked on mouse events when `useToggleSelection` and `selectOnMouseDown` were set (it now works when any mouse handling results in a "select").

Prevents mousewheel events that occur immediately after mouseup from triggering a value change. The Apple Magic Mouse is particularly noisy with mousewheel events and it's common for a couple events to fire while the user lifts their finger. This code ignores mousewheel events for 250ms after a mouseup event so that the slider doesn't jump erratically about.

Prevents mousewheel events from jumping the slider while the mouse is pressed (i.e. for dragging). Certain mice have a very jittery wheel event (i.e. the Apple Magic Mouse) that results in wheel events firing while the user is trying to drag a slider.

- Fixes a ScrollView bug where child view tiling was failing to trigger min/max recalculations when it caused a container view resize.
- A number of unit tests were failing because SC.ScrollView now updates its layer asynchronously. Fixed these by cheating and triggering the update synchronously.

SC.ScrollView:

Adds polymorphic record support to SC.Record. This experimental framework has been in use in a few projects and has recently been vastly improved to fix bugs and improve its performance. Includes unit tests and examples

Fixes a critical bug in polymorphic record support while significantly improving performance and reducing memory consumption of polymorphic records.

The previous polymorphic record support took care to ensure that the same store key was returned for all polymorphic classes by duplicating the store key to id mapping on each related polymorphic class. But where it failed was in situations where the store manipulated the store keys hashes directly (ex. replaceIdFor()), which would result in different store key to id mappings between polymorphic classes. Also, duplicating the mapping on each class was very wasteful and slow due to recursion. Instead, now the mapping is stored only once on the root polymorphic record and all subclasses simply reference it directly. This removes the duplicate memory use and removes the need to recurse each time that a new polymorphic record is added to the store.

Improves SC.State performance by removing expensive observers.

SC.State had two `observes` helper functions used to be notified when its `enteredSubstates` and `currentSubstates` arrays change. Since these arrays are modified by the owner statechart, the observers needed to be chained enumerable observers. However, this resulted in slower object initialization for each state object and excess observer firing as the entered and current substates change. Instead, we simply notify the target state directly each time that the statechart makes a change to its `enteredSubstates` and `currentSubstates`.

Benchmarks:
  initStatechart in unit tests: ~21ms to ~13ms (~38% faster)
  initStatechart in large application: ~81ms to ~51ms (~37% faster)

Fixes SC.ObserverSet to pass the given context to the observer method.

SC.ObserverSet.prototype.add() accepts a third argument, context, but it did not actually pass it along to the observer method. This has been fixed (includes unit test).

Improves SC.ScrollView performance a tiny bit by removing the unnecessary chained binding back from the scrollers to their owner. Scrollers are created automatically by the SC.ScrollView and are not moved between different owners.
Fixes the docs a tiny bit for SC.ScrollView.

Significantly improves performance of SC.PickerPanes attached to element's within an SC.ScrollView.

There were a couple of issues hampering performance for SC.PickerPanes within SC.ScrollViews. The first was that the scroll view observers were too greedy observing (the unfortunately noisy) horizontalScrollOffset and verticalScrollOffset of the scroll view for changes and repositioning on each change. What this meant was that an SC.PickerPane could reposition itself up to 6 times in a single run loop as the content of the scroll view changed even thought the scroll offsets may not have changed at all. Instead, the proper pattern for observing multiple properties (or noisy properties) is to filter the input through an invokeX (i.e. so even though 6 calls to the observer function occur, we only call positionPane once, via invokeOnce). Additionally, we no longer observe the offsets if the scroll view can't even scroll (in either direction). And finally, to ensure that the anchor element is in its new position before we re-position, we actually use invokeNext as our input filter.
Fixes several inconsistencies in property referencing within SC.PickerPane. There were multiple places where '.' notation was used instead of get/set. Also tidies up some unclear code.

Fixes a noisy reposition of SC.PickerPane.

The pane listened to changes to its borderFrame in order to know whether to reposition itself or not. This means that changes to its size (width/height) allowed it to reposition to best fit, but because repositioning ends up changing the same borderFrame, it meant one (potentially dangerous) extra call through positionPane for no reason. Instead, we use viewDidResize, which only gets called on size (width/height) changes.

Fixes a problem with excessive layout updates for certain types of views. If a view used `viewDidResize` to check for size changes and then make further adjustments to its position, because of a late cache update, the adjustments to its position would appear as further changes to its size. In particular, SC.PickerPane suffered from this, since it re-positions itself whenever its size changes.

Removes the enabling of run loop logging when SC.LOG_BINDINGS is set. The run loop logs are very noisy and make it harder to follow the binding changes. Also forces some of the logging code into debug builds only.
Improves the un-themed default vertical overlay scroller style to leave a small gap to the right (akin to modern OS X).
Nested store - Improve the test case for writeDataHash. Force a get on the child records to be sure that they are materialized.
Nested store - Fixes a bug where the changes pushed using writeDataHash are not propagate to the child records hashes and eventually to the corresponding child records from the parent store.
SC.Pane#append (and subclasses!) should return the receiver. Includes the platonic ideal of unit tests.
Cancels active transitions in SC.ContainerView when transitionSwap is altered mid-transition. Includes a developer warning.
Adds tiny grammar fix.
Adds retina version images for SC.SliderView in Ace.
Fixes broken unit test.

Deprecates the view() addition to SC.$ in favor of a new SC.viewFor() method. The SC.$.view() method was called excessively by SC.RootResponder to find the target SC.View instance for events, but was wasteful as it requires creating an Array in jQuery only to ever use the first item. SC.viewFor method does the same thing about three times faster.
Removes several lines of debugging code from production builds of SC.Observable using @if(debug).
Fixes failing unit tests, due to the locale being improperly cleaned up when changed.
Automatic whitespace tidy.
Fixes failing unit test after jQuery upgrade.

Merge pull request #1196 from sproutcore/team/nicolasbadia/localization

Improves localization support

Merge pull request #1237 from sproutcore/team/fairbanksg/benchmark-fixes

Clean up SC.Benchmark.
Tidies a tiny bit.

Merge pull request #1246 from sproutcore/team/dcporter/bye-experimental-scroll

Removes outdated experimental scroll-view framework.
Closes #863  Fixes merge conflicts and removes extra cycles of calling `unloadRecord` on children and `unregisterChildFromParent` on the parent.
Fixes typos and jshint warnings.
Removes comment that is being sniffed by the build tools as a require() command.
Fixes broken `isSameDomain` in Internet Explorer. IE doesn't support window.location.origin.

Updates to latest version of jQuery, 1.11.1. Notably, there was a serious memory leak in jQuery 1.8 where the tokenCache grew continuously (because keys in the cache have a " " appended to them and the code tried to delete keys without taking the " " into account).

Fixes memory leaks in SC.ListView and SC.CollectionView. Since these views add observers to their related objects, they need to also properly remove those observers again when the views themselves are destroyed. Otherwise, when collection views are removed, the observers on the related objects become stranded.
SC.Query's internal token tree should be a proper SC.Error when in an error state. (Someone should make SC.Query the same.) Adds unit tests.
Reverts removal of `enhance` in SC.Pane. It is required still in order to wrap the makeFirstResponder method of SC.ResponderContext.
Removes `enhance` functions from SC.Pane. These are extremely slow on Firefox, somewhat slow on Safari and negligibly slow on Chrome.
Removes unneeded requirement.
Removes unused file.

Removes all uses of enhance within the SC.View reopens in core_foundation. The `_enhance` function is inordinately slow in Firefox (version 31 on OS X). Benchmarks of creating 100 views in a loop takes ~1800ms with the enhance's and only ~38ms without any in Firefox on OS X. In Chrome and Safari on OS X, the difference is negligible.
Fixes missing requirement in SC.ListView.
Removes unnecessary sc_require statements.

Fixes SC.CollectionView integration with design modes. Don't set the designMode as an attribute directly, because updateDesignMode will be called on the child view properly when it is added. If designMode is set beforehand, then updateDesignMode will fast path out thinking there is no change (rather than apply the modeAdjust adjustments).

Fixes previous failing unit tests.
Adds unit tests for SC.CollectionView integration with design modes.
Tidies a tiny bit.
Removes an excess display property (i.e. an observer) in all instances using SC.ContentDisplay, since `content` is already observed for changes and `displayDidChange` is called within that function.
When the online/offline value of window changes, ensure that a run loop runs when setting isOffline of SC.device.
Updates to use the value property of the DOM Attribute, since nodeValue is deprecated.
Removes unused private variable.

Adds a check for the presence of a scroller before attempting to fade it in. It's possible that someone may want to force scrollability without scrollers by setting canScrollX: true and hasXScroller: false.
Fixes a regression in the code refactor and adds some more documentation.
Refactors commandCodes function of SC.Event to be easier to read and with more descriptive inline documentation.
Cleans a la jshint.
Updates to match updated jshint options.
Updates to match updated jshint options.

Adds support for setting the `withCredentials` property of the XHR request to true when the request is across domains and the request object permits it (via allowCredentials, which is true by default). This allows CORS requests to include cookies, whereas they otherwise would not. Includes unit tests.

Adds new properties to SC.Request instances: allowCredentials (default true, which will indicate that credentials be included for cross-domain requests (e.g. xhr.withCredentials = true) and isSameDomain (readonly computed property, true if the protocol, domain and port match exactly).

These new properties can be used by an SC.Response subclass to include allowing credentials for cross domain requests. Includes unit tests.
Removes whitespace.

Merge pull request #1288 from tobias-g/auto_resize_padding_fix

Auto resize padding fix for SC.TextFieldView
Added unit tests for autoresize inputs with padding fix
fixed auto resize prepareLayerForStringMeasurement to take padding on a layer into account when setting the maxWidth on the layer
SC.BInding - Adds a transform that aggregates through a function the values at given paths.
Unit tests updated for previous code change.
Ensures that views that are orphaned update their pane and adds more comments on the purpose of this code.
Ensure computeLayout returns sane values when itemsPerRow is 0 (including test)
Use 24-hour clock notation for french times
Fixes a memory leak where subMenu was never destroy
Live update subMenu if its content changed
Ensures that views notify their pane changes when ancestor parent changes.
Fixes failing local unit tests (invalid layouts provided).
Removes commented out code.
Restricts selection by index to being enabled so that selection by object still works when necessary.

This allows duplicate items to appear in a collection and still be selected independently. Previously, all collection view selection was done per object, which would mean the first instance of the object in the content was always selected. Instead, selection is done by index only so that the same object can appear many times and each be selected separately.
Removes deprecated tests.
Removes two long deprecated views that just muddy the waters.
Removes an unused class.
Replaces a couple of latent style.webkitTransform calls with experimentalStyleNameFor.
Fixes blurry transforms while scrolling scaled content. Fixes #1273.
Minor clarifications and typo-squashing in the SC.Touch documentation.
Fixes some typos and brainos in the new SC.View documentation.
Finally replaces ScrollView's scroll offsets, alignment and scale with modern CSS transforms. Working on #1267.
convertFrame*View now consider the views' scale value
But there IS no force parameter.
Fixes some SC.SliderView documentation.

Un-breaks touch on several controls that broke after 50ddf31649ba9482f611a21ca9ef7c90201c9cd7 added right-button click rejection. This is a partial measure; the correct approach will be to separate out click and touch handling rather than simply proxying touches through the click handler; should also include testing. Resolves #1250.
Adds some documentation to SC.DragSource. Adds op argument to new dragDidCancel and dragDidSucceed methods.
Added dragDidSucceed, dragDidCancell, source.dragSlideBackDidEnd callbacks
Removes reference to axed data-drag responder events.
Improves performance and behavior when SC.PickerPane#popup is called with a jQuery anchor; adds unit test coverage for SC.PickerPane.anchorElement setter.
Fixes typos and removes unnecessary sc_require.
Reimplement itemValueKey support to SC.MenuPane
Fixed excessively high scroll offset values in test
Deferred scale related calculations to the end of run loop, so give time for other intermediary calculations
SC.ContainerView can now take local property paths as nowShowing.
Fixes a bug where (non-scaling) ScrollView would fail to remove mid-touch transform styles from its contentView's layer. Addresses (part of) #1252.
Do not compute the ordinal in a language if no method is defined
Fixes a bug where FlowedLayout views failed to stop observing the layout of removed childViews.
Improves performance by refactoring SC.View's layerId caching to remove an  closure.

Un-deprecates rotate, for use in browsers without 3D support (i.e. IE9). In supporting browsers, rotate is proxied to rotateZ for performance. (If rotate and rotateZ are both supplied, both are applied.)
Updates CHANGELOG.
Deprecates  and removes its use in SC.Page and elsewhere. Resolves #485.
Removes outdated references to SC.ContainerView#awake from several unit tests. Involved in #485.
Moves SC.TabView's userDefaults support from awake to init. Preliminary requirement for #485.
Deprecates the SC.Object#superclass instance method. Resolves #518.
Removes outdated experimental scroll-view framework.
Updates CHANGELOG.
Updates CHANGELOG.
Fixes a bug where destroying a view with the mouse over it would trigger a crashing root responder error. Hat tip to @fairbanksg. Closes #1226.
Updates CHANGELOG.
adding tests for SC.String#fmt KVO
allow passing not only hashes but SC.Object instances for SC.String#fmt which allows the use of computed properties as well as unknownProperty to calculate a value
Adds a helpful developer error when trying to create a nested attribute with an inverse property.

• Tidies SC.Drag.
• Fixes an issue where SC.Drag would call `dragStarted` on all drop targets regardless of whether they were visible or not, such that a drop target that implemented `dragStarted` may throw an exception because it expects to only be called when visible.
Fixes typo.
Fixes bug introduced in the previous commit. Includes test.
Adds steps and stepPositions properties to SC.SliderView to make it easier to position things at each step. Refactors renderer to use stepPositions and improve performance.
Tweaks SliderView thumb layout in Ace.
Fixes issue in SC.SliderView delegate. If 'markSteps' is not true and did not change, it would render the steps on the first update.
Adds unit test for slider step mark indexed class names.
Adds index class-name to slider step marks, allowing the developer to easily target the nth choink.
point sc_static to the correct framework to load sproutcore-32.png from

Adds a new isValueEqualTo method to SC.SelectView

This method is used by the select view and the menu to check if the
current value and a passed item are equal.
This commit also fixe an issue with array of string items.
Adds scale properties to borderFrame. Updates PickerPane's pointer positioning to correct for visual glitches caused with scaling transforms. Fixes the important half of #1213.
Adds updateOnScroll property to SliderView to allow the developer to turn off scroll event hijacking.

Merge pull request #1217 from sproutcore/team/publickeating/link_view

Adds a new SC.LinkView for creating simple programmable HTML anchors.
Updates changelog.
Disables ScrollView alignment properties in the case of flexible layouts, with which they presently conflict.
Added new test for when content view's layout is fixed to the parent view. Refactored the tests to use SC.ControlTestPane/
When adjusting scroll offset, prioritize using minimum offset to avoid miscalculation
Added tests for scroll view scaling changes
Improved scroll view scaling to pivot around center of viewable area
Added originalHeight and originalWidth to view frames
Fixes typo in unit test from prior commit.
Fixes a number of unit tests that broke in the previous commit.
Splits isFixedSize up into isFixedWidth and isFixedHeight for further child view notification optimization. Includes tests.
Adds ability to specify message in CoreTest.stub().expect calls.
Fixes bug where slider view values of 0 would render at the left-hand edge regardless of the minimum. Includes unit test. Fixes #1129.
Fixes typo.
Updates the Change log and renames fillAvailableSpaceRatio to the more concise fillRatio.

Adds the SC.ChildViewLayoutProtocol referenced in the code that didn't exist.
Adds a new optional method `layoutDependsOnSize` to SC.ChildViewLayoutProtocol that determines whether the child view layout plugin needs to re-run when the view's frame changes. This is required for flexible views that lay out their child views dynamically based on their size. Because the view's layout doesn't change even when its frame does, it otherwise would not re-layout the child views.
Removes the ill-conceived attempt to include maxWidth/maxHeight for auto-fill.

Extensions to @mirions stacked layout changes:

- Tidies up a la jshint.
- Ensures that 100% of the available space is used up even with rounded layout values.
- Fixes a bug where a right/bottom position could be a decimal (ex. 0.25) which becomes 25% not 0.
- Adds support for maxWidth/maxHeight to constrain how much available space is used for the child view (allows following child views to use more).
HORIZONTAL_STACK and VERTICAL_STACK: Add tests for fillAvailableSpaceRatio

HORIZONTAL_STACK and VERTICAL_STACK: when not configured with resizeToFit, let any child not specifying a fixed dimension to fill the available space. To calculate the final dimension/layout, a new property "fillAvailableSpaceRatio" is used
Updates CHANGELOG.
Removes default responder data-drag events.
removed z-index from popover
Make use of compass

SC.WorkspaceView: fix topToolbar & bottomToolbar z-index

See https://github.com/sproutcore/sproutcore/issues/1033

Merge pull request #1230 from sproutcore/team/fairbanksg/interpret-key-events-crash

Fix crash in interpretKeyEvents.

Merge pull request #1234 from jameschao/layout_warning_fix

Fixes for various failing tests
Explicitly specifying mouse event pageX and pageY for drag and drop tests
Fixed menu UI tests by specifying primary mouse button
Added sanity checks into grid layout computation
Fixed layout value warning to accept other valid layout values
Removes an invalid condition that prevents key down validation in any browsers that support touch events (which has nothing to do with whether touch events will be used or not).
Fixes an extremely rare security vulnerability in SC.TextFieldView that could occur if a hint overlay is used that included user generated hint. Also fixes @type of applyImmediately.

Adds debug-mode only property validation to the layout property. Argument and property validation helps developers save time by failing at the root of the problem, providing useful messages and avoiding difficult to diagnose infinite loops. Normally, this type of validation would come at the expense of the performance of an application, but fortunately SproutCore's build tools allow us to separate all of this code entirely from production builds. Win-win!
Fixes up unit test and adds specific check for `hintOnFocus` being set to false.
Adds warning for a possible cause of a failing unit test dependent on how the test was run.
Fixes invalid unit test.

Improves hint implementation of SC.TextFieldView. Previously, there were 3 ways to display the hint: via placeholder attribute, via a text overlay or via setting an initial value of the input field. The last way, setting the value of the input, is the oldest method and the least useful, because it requires a lot of extra work to modify the type of the input when it is a password field into a text field. This work is made even worse because Internet Explorer doesn't allow you to modify the type of the field and so the code gets quite ugly and has been the source of a lot of bugs.

But the second approach, using a text overlay, can do all of this with much simpler code and therefore we've removed the legacy approach for a two method approach: 1) use the placeholder when possible, unless hintOnFocus is true, or else 2) use a text overlay.
Removes long deprecated properties of SC.TextFieldView: isPassword & continuouslyUpdatesValue. Starts standardizing to true/false.
Fixes typo regression as noted by @nicolasbadia.
Removed hard-coded prefix for transforms
Removes duplicated functionality. Since arrayContentDidChange calls enumerableContentDidChange, we don't need to independently update firstObject & lastObject.
Expands on the lastObject enumerable tests to ensure that they are fully testing the behavior.
Fixes failing unit tests that weren't specific about which mouse button was being simulated and were being rejected.

Merge pull request #1012 from mirion/mirion_dev/flowed_layout

SC.FlowedLayout - when adding a child view, the layout is not calculated properly and the new child is positioned on top of others

Prevents mouse events from being trapped by overlay scroll views when they are not visible. This allows buttons to be partially covered by an overlay scroll view and still be clickable unless the mouse wheel brings the scroller visible again. This isn't supported in IE < 11, but it's a simple improvement and worthwhile for the majority of browsers. The alternative is to capture the event, determine the target beneath the scroller and simulate the event there, which is much more involved.
Fixes comment placement.
Uses KVC to assign parentView, owner & page properties to view instances that are passed to createChildView. This ensures that any computed properties (notably layoutView) invalidate appropriately.
Removes rejection of secondary clicks on collection views, since it is often the case that we want a context menu for the selected item to appear.
Only accept primary button clicks on controls. i.e. right clicking on a button shouldn't trigger the button
Uses the inner width of the element for constraining against when measuring height. This takes padding into account so that the measured height is correct.
Adds feature detection for new <a> attributes and uses them to prevent failing tests on other environments. Also adds the WAI-ARIA role to SC.LinkView output.
Updates unit test so that it should still be valid in PhantomJS environment.
Removes long deprecated SC.Scrollable mixin.
Completes #1211.
Adds a new SC.LinkView for creating simple programmable HTML anchors.
Fixes bad unit test that invalidated the length of the SparseArray before updating the delegates test length.
Improves (hopefully) documentation for didChangeFor.
Adds basic theming to Ace for SliderView step marks.
Adds step mark elements to SliderView. Includes unit tests.
Improves SC.SliderView documentation. Tidies up renderer. Fixes several bugs where setting step to null would break things.

Removes SC.ManyArray backing datahash array observers. Previously, the datahash's storeIds array was observed, but this adds the observable properties to it, which in effect alters the array. This is now prohibited and all access must be done through the proper KVO channels on the ManyArray or by setting the property on the inverse record.

Fixes #715

Prevents duplicate notifies on the '[]' property. While most array-like objects are careful to call both enumerableContentDidChange and arrayContentDidChange together, some of them failed to wrap these to calls in beginPropertyChanges/endPropertyChanges, because both of these calls notify that the '[]' property has changed.

Instead, we will use arrayContentDidChange to call enumerableContentDidChange itself, which makes coding the array-like objects easier/faster and prevents the serious problem that '[]' observers are fired twice in a row (was a problem of SC.ChildArray).
Fixes a boneheaded docs typo.
Refactors previous commit to swap duplicate code for fewer Objects.
Removes apparently nonsensical sc_require.
Fixes bugs with SC.ArrayController's orderBy range observers. Resolves #1214.
Adds unit tests proving issues with SC.ArrayController's orderBy range observer handling (#1214).
Fixes documentation of SC.FOCUS_ALL_CONTROLS and removes long deprecated warning.
Works around well-established IE XHR bug where 204 statuses are mysteriously returned with status 1223. Courtesy of Luke Chambers.
add requirement for panes/pane_statechart to prevent maximum call stack error with strict sort order rules
Adds gated developer warning for SC.Request#notify('loadend'), which fails silently on certain platforms. Closes #1177.
Fixes another unit test broken by 5469173fc7ac1d5eb11d745ebd9e7dac8802ace1.
Fixes unit tests broken by previous commit.
Fixes bug where layout rotate property was being incorrectly fixed to rotateX instead of rotateZ. Addresses (part of) #1210.
Fixes bug where children of ATTACHED_SHOWING views are ATTACHED_HIDDEN_BY_PARENT. Fixes #1190.
Fixes a bug where picker panes would adjust their layout size to the scaled values. (Layout size values are pre-scale.)
Tweaks the private _animateFrames to allow calling it without a callback method.

Overhauls SC.ScrollView#scale, and a number of related subsystems.
- Adds official SC.Scalable protocol.
- Overhauls SC.ScrollView#scale, decoupling it from touch events and allowing it to be bound and set. Updates it to use layout scale property when not mid-touch. Improves and isolates special mid-touch scroll & scale positioning.)
- Bonus: Fixes a visual glitch in the default Ace scrollers where the thumb would overlay the buttons by a couple pixels too many. Looks much cleaner now.
Includes unit tests.

Turns scale into a first-class layout function, correctly impacting frame and clippingFrame.
- Adds SC.scaleRect, a convenience method for scaling a rectangle about an origin.
- Adds two new layout properties, transformOriginX and transformOriginY, to control the origin of scale and rotate properties.
- Frame and clippingFrame now take scale, transformOriginX and transformOriginY into account. As previously (but moreso now that scale is involved),  is relative to a view’s parent’s coordinate grid, while  is relative to a view’s own coordinate grid.
- Includes unit tests.
SC.SelectView itemTitleKey and itemValueKey are now null by default
SC.SelectView itemTitleKey can now be null
The menu items weren't updated if an item were add to the select view
Fixes an issue where other SC.CollectionView item view layouts bled into CollectionViews-that-don't-provide-item-view- layouts' layouts due to a shared object.
Fixes ListView insertion point, which broke a few commits back. (Thanks to @nicolasbadia for tracking down the issue.) Includes unit test.
Adds firmer argument validation to SC.IndexSet methods in debug mode.
Fixes ListView bug where rowSpacing was being ignored when calculating contentIndexesInRect, causing minor item view blinkage. Fixes #1204.
Updates ListView unit tests from rowHeightForContentIndex to rowSizeForContentIndex.
Tweaks backward compatibility for SC.ListView to correctly detect and use rowHeightForContentIndex if present.
Sets a more specific auto resize padding value for SC.LabelView that doesn't add height, only width.

Fixes a bug where native touch handling was impossible in ScrollView.
Strengthens behavior of SC.ScrollView#delaysContentTouches: it's now the responsibility of any descendent view which handles the touch to pass it back to ScrollView with SC.Touch#restoreLastTouchResponder. Includes tests for new behavior and improves coverage for existing behavior.

Adds `stackCandidateTouchResponder` to SC.Touch.

Allows views to add themselves as a fallback responder (e.g. during the `captureTouch` scan) without having touchStart and touchCancelled needlessly called on them if they end up not receiving the touch.

At the end of commitSuccessfulChanges, reset the local private statuses of the CLEAN records (just pushed to the main store) so these records are no longer managed by the nested store but by the main store.
Add a method to push only successful changes to the main store. This allows easy management in the case of completely independent rows being sent to the server and only a part of them being accepted.

Allows the nested store to perform server-side transactions via the data source. This produces a proper separation between the different layers so the main store contains only data that has been approved and committed by the backend server.

Fixes SC.AutoResize when configured to resize height only. Previously, the measurement of height didn't include the height required to wrap inline content within the width of the given element. This meant that the measured heights were almost always incorrect. Includes unit tests.
Moves contributor list to its own file. Polishes README, including new Next Steps section.
Updates runtime to allow subclass binding overrides. Refactors reopen. Includes unit tests.
Gives SC.Binding its own long-overdue quack.
Adds support to SC.TabView for displaying local views, analogous to SC.ContainerView's support. Includes tests.
Works around race condition in SC.ContainerView.DISSOLVE (aping SC.ContainerView.PUSH's solution).
Tweaks SC.ObjectDesigner#didCreateObject to work around an issue with the recent changes to SC.Record instantiation.

Privatizes the convenience computed property of rowSize + rowPadding, because it just adds confusion on which is correct: rowSize vs. totalRowSize. Renames rowSizePlusPadding to _sc_totalRowSize (private).
Updates the documentation to improve grammar and include both vertical and horizontal layout functionality.
Renames contentIndexRowHeight to contentIndexRowSize.

Adds layoutDirection property to SC.ListView. Refactors SC.ListView and SC.CollectionRowDelegate to move away from height specific methods and properties to generic height or width methods and properties.

Also fixes issue that rowSpacing set on the row delegate had no effect on the list item layout.
Uses a bindng default to ensure SC.ImageView value bindings are oneWay.

A number of improvements to touch handling.
- Adds documentation for SC.Touch and touch events.
- Adds convenience methods to SC.Touch for more intuitively passing touch responder status between views.
- Moves SC.Touch to its own file.
- Adds unit tests for SC.RootResponder's touch event behavior.
Accidentally committed temporary test code. Fixes previous commit as it should be.
Fixes exception when hitting the return key on editable collection view with no selection. Refactored the method to prevent attempting to edit invalid item views. Includes unit test.

Prevents SC.CollectionView.prototype.itemViewForContentIndex() from returning item views for invalid indexes. It's easy for loops and other code to accidentally retrieve an index not within the collection, which would have previously returned an item view not backed by content and with other invalid attributes. Instead, the method will return null for invalid indexes and in debug mode only will present a warning to help the developer track down the problem. Includes unit tests.
Updates runtime to remove minor dependencies on jQuery. Moves root jquery framework dependency from runtime to core_foundation.
Fix issue with SC.SelectView not updating list of items when items is set to an empty array.  With test
Ensures that the format property of SC.DateField updates when formatDateTime, formatDate or formatTime change. Includes unit test.
Adds minimal-ui flag to viewport meta tag in index.rhtml.
Adds debug-mode only toString method for SC.ChildArray to give a bit more information akin to SC.ManyArray & SC.RecordArray.

Refactors SC.ChildArray to:
 - remove range observers on the underlying data hash array
 - tackle the difficult issue of separating removed nested records from the array and the parent record (fixes failing unit tests)
 - optimizes SC.ChildArray to not be as noisy
 - clean up a bunch of incorrect documentation copied and pasted over from SC.ManyArray
 - hopefully, makes the code more understandable and easy-to-follow
Small cleanup of unit test.
Tidies up SC.ChildrenAttribute and removes the call override which doesn't appear to add any value.
Adds tests highlighting the intricacies of how nested records change depending on when and how they're accessed.
Tidies nested record unit tests.
Adds tests showing problems working with SC.ChildArray items. Adds test for deep property (more than one level nested) updates.
Fixes circular dependency between view/animation and view/layout_style.
Fixes the debug only SC.PickerPane message. This helps developers avoid confusion if accidentally calling append instead of popup on a picker pane.
Fixes bug that doesn't clear nested records from a store reset (fixes failing unit test in previous commit).
Adds unit tests verifying the reset of an SC.Store.
JSHint cleanup.
Prevents SC.CollectionView from pooling views that don't have a layout (i.e. static views). Fixes failing unit test.
Removes forcing the prototype layout onto all child views which is redundant and prevents child views from having their own layout.
Tiny bit of whitespace clean up.
Renames `escapeForCss` to the less-nice but more-precise `escapeCssIdForSelector`.
Updates README with some better links and new verbiage.

Revert "Swaps out @jlaxson's SC.SegmentedView#shouldAutoResize for @publickeating's suggestion that the behavior be mediated by setting shouldHandleOverflow to NO. (There is currently no way to prevent resizing in a static-width segmented view with shouldHandleOverflow: NO; if that's a need, it shouldn't be hard to implement.)"

This reverts commit 3f9128971e9ce7da0b97221a3dbd71975a90fb7c.

Fixes a number of issues with SC.SplitView:

- Adds layoutDirection property and class-name to SplitDividerView. Hooks up propagation from parent SplitView.
- Fixes bug where SplitView's class-names would update incorrectly when layoutDirection changed. (Previous class was not being removed.)
- Fixes CSS bug where selector hierarchies were insufficiently specific, causing a misapplication of styles in nested SplitViews with different layoutDirections.
- Includes unit tests.
Improves view event documentation. Fixes a typo which was conveying some bad information.
Adds some debug-mode only developer support to prevent the easy mistake of using .append(anchor) with a picker pane instead of .popup(anchor).
Sets the windowPadding of SC.PickerPane to default value once rather than checking it each time.
Privatizes pointer layout array used internally by SC.PickerPane. Also tidies code a bit.

Adds much more descriptive documentation for configuring SC.PickerPanes including the use of new constants SC.POSITION_RIGHT, SC.POSITION_LEFT, SC.POSITION_TOP & SC.POSITION_BOTTOM to make the values of preferMatrix more clear.

Merge pull request #1185 from sproutcore/team/fairbanksg/collection-view-layer-id

Use CollectionView's layerId rather than guid in contentIndexForLayerId.

Improves SC.AlertPane documentation. Adds unit tests for, and fixes, bug where passing more than three button hashes to AlertPane.show would crash your app. Adds and unit tests localization option for button titles.

Fix build status image.

Specify master branch for travis build status image.
Adds sniffer for XHR2 features (and loadend event) to SC.platform. Updates SC.Response to use centralized SC.platform sniffers. Updates SC.Request unit tests to pass!

Provides correct workaround for browsers which support ProgressEvent but not the loadend event. Fixes bug introduced in 4f44c8fc57967c5747fa813421a1a24422438fb0 where SC.Request load (or error or abort) notifications would fail to fire in said browsers.
Improves phantomjs test runner documentation.
Updates SC.Request pending/inflight unit tests to pass.
Works around an issue where some browsers may support ProgressEvent without supporting the loadend event.
Fixes SC.routes bug where browser history events would trigger history updates, doubling up the history state. Includes really terrible unit test. Fixes #719.
Adds some documentation to SC.Binding to clarify the issue raised in #859.

Swaps out @jlaxson's SC.SegmentedView#shouldAutoResize for @publickeating's suggestion that the behavior be mediated by setting shouldHandleOverflow to NO. (There is currently no way to prevent resizing in a static-width segmented view with shouldHandleOverflow: NO; if that's a need, it shouldn't be hard to implement.)
Clarifies SC.SegmentedView#shouldAutoResize documentation re: shouldHandleOverflow.
Implements SC.SegmentedView#shouldAutoResize, courtesy of @jlaxson. Includes unit tests. Resolves #974.
Adds unit tests for SC.Binding.equalTo.
Improves SC.Binding documentation. Marks a number of advanced and rarely-used methods private, in an effort to clean up the (rather intimidating) doc page.
Adds a transform that will return YES if the value is equal to equalValue, NO otherwise
Updates experimental SC.SelectView for backward-compatibility with legacy view.
SC.MenuPane now ignores the first item if it is a separator
Adds escapeHTML to SC.MenuPane
Tweaks primary key behavior in SC.Record#normalize. Fixes bug where it would fail to identify RecordAttribute subclasses. Closes #1127.
Deactivates SC.ManyArray#supportNewRecord by default. Converts failing unit tests to warnings.
Adds 'warn' method to testing suite.

Updates SC.Color with writable cssText and an error state. Includes unit tests.

Note that this changes the behavior of SC.Color.from, which previously returned NO for invalid input and now returns an SC.Color in error mode. You should use SC.ok() to test the validity of a created color. This will work both before and after this commit.
Fixes edge-case bug which made it impossible to clear a dynamic backgroundColor.
Fixes comments, tidies whitespace.
SegmentedView no longer sucks up mouseDown events that originate outside of a segment, allowing (e.g.) PalettePane to be dragged around. Includes unit test.

Adds support for vertically/horizontally stacking collection views that only provide a minHeight/minWidth respectively. If there is no height/width in the layout, then we try to use the minHeight/minWidth.
Fixes a bug where retrieving not-yet-loaded records from a nested store will lock those records as EMPTY and fail to update them when they load into the master store. Includes unit test.
Implements a safe workaround to the SC.Store#materializeRecord issue which was causing records to sometimes invisibly be created twice. Includes unit test. Resolves #1160.
Tweaks Travis-CI startup script to work around 'Bad substitution' error.

Removes problematic touch browser optimization which prevented TextFieldViews from becoming first responder if their input field was not already focused. This was to avoid running relatively expensive makeFirstResponder code uselessly (as you can't shift focus programmatically outside of a touch event) on slower mobile devices, but it failed to account for useful calls to focus one view (e.g. an inline editor) in the context of a touch to a different view (e.g. its parent LabelView). If this deoptimization proves noticeable, another way of confirming touch-event context should be found. Resolves #1166.
Fixes a typo in SC.UndoManager
Fixes SC.CollectionView#designMode unit test to allow testing of SC.CollectionView#designMode.
Fixes bug where SC.CollectionView#itemViewForContentObject could throw errors.
Fixes bug where fading scroll views would be stuck visible whenever the size of the content changed.
Fixes RootResponder's design mode handling of device pixel density.
Adds stub updateDesignModes method to SC.CoreView to un-break SC.TemplateView.
Adds centerX and centerY to SLIDE transitions (thanks @nicolasbadia).

Tidies a bit.
Fixes a problem where an Overlay scroller renders incorrectly on first render.
Fixes numerous CSS problems and redundant styles for scrollers.
Adds sc-overlay-scroller-view class to SC.OverlayScrollerView and uses new class in theme.
Allows the overlay scroller to scroll further down/right, since there are no scroll buttons visible.
Removes duplicated code in SC.OverlayScrollerView.

Fixes fading for SC.OverlayScrollerView in browsers that can’t transition opacity of child nodes with 3D translations on them. Since the thumb portion of the scroller is translated and since it is not an SC.View, we can’t call .animate on it directly and calling .animate on the actual parent node’s SC.View fails to work too.

Also, changes the fade out implementation slightly to only call fadeIn/fadeOut once on the ScrollView per change, which speeds things up a lot and saves the ScrollView implmentation from having to track state. Also ensures that the scrollviews don’t only fade out on append, but also fade back in on re-append or re-show.

Also, renames fadeDelay to fadeOutDelay to be more explicit on what the delay is (fade in vs. fade out) and removes fadeInDuration/fadeOutDuration, because the fade animation is strictly handled by the scroller.
Cleans up SC.ScrollerView per jshint (including removing a truck load of unused variables).
Replaces webkit specific transform CSS with browser specific transform CSS.

Assorted transition fixes.
- Fixes bug where transitions were failing to revert to implied layouts (my bad).
- Adds layoutProperties list to slide transitions.
- Fixes layoutProperties on slide transitions which was fixing transitioned properties at opacity: 1, overriding CSS (e.g. from isEnabled).
- Fixes bug where transitions were caching 0-value properties as null (my bad).
Fixes code documentation markup. Thanks @mirion.
Improves documentation for SC.ScrollView.
Renames SC.TouchScrollerView to SC.OverlayScrollerView. Retains a copy on SC.TouchScrollerView with developer warning. Improves SC.ScrollerView documentation.
Implements fading overlay scrollers.
Fixes incorrect display of progress value when a minimum is used. Includes unit test.
Forgot to add closing parenthesis to the new inflection constants
Adds ordinal function for the french language
Adds inflection constants for french and spanish languages
Adds 2 new methods to add hashes and method to a locale
Improves documentation of Number.ordinal. Fixes bug that may have been preventing ordinal localization.
Adds the .lproj extension to DateTime localizations directories
Refactors SC.PickerPane's anchor stowage (hat-tip to @fairbanksg). Fixes some memory leaks on destroy. Fixes #896.
Adds support for freeform number entry to SC.DateFieldView
Refactors SC.UndoManager, adding support for the target/action pattern via registerUndoAction. Deprecates registerUndo. Improves documentation.
Renames SC.UndoManager#levelsOfUndo to maxStackLength for clarity.
Refactors SC.UndoManager to allow easier grouping. Includes unit tests.
Cleans a la jshint.
Fix the Ajax progress events handling. The event used previously, XMLHttpRequestProgressEvent, is webkit specific and is not supported by Firefox or IE.
Adds the 'msie' class to the body element when in IE. Fixes #971.
Implements an actual honest-to-god SC.Drag#slideBack. Resolves #512.
Adds some internal notes to SC.ListView#showInsertionPoint.
Fixes bug where dragging content onto an empty list view would throw an error. Resolves #402.
Adds unit test proving empty list view drag bug (#402).
Prevents the appendChild ATTACHED_SHOWN developer warning when called on the child's existing parent, as for example with SC.ListView's insertion point.
Improves documentation for RecordArray.
Resolves issue where canvas elements in drag layers were showing up blank. Fixes #788.
Replaces improper interpretKeyEvent override in select views with proper named events. Fixes #1148.
Improves some keyboard event documentation.
Adds French DateTime localizations, courtesy of @mirion.
Fixes NestedRecord by improving on Tyler's work.
Minor cleanup and improvement to efficiency in SegmentedView's overflow calculation. Fixes #891.
Adds documentation for new ordinal formatter in SC.DateTime.
Prevents selectAll and deselectAll depending on delegate's allowMultipleSelection and allowEmptySelection flags. Includes unit tests.
Fixes a bug where the new smarter view transition reset was failing to reset undefined layout properties to their defaults.
SC.NestedStore use the callback argument on retrieveRecords
Bumps showcase submodule.
Adds 'text/uri-list' to the data-drag content types whose default behavior is canceled. Prevents the browser from killing the app and opening the dragged URL. Includes unit tests.

Adds layoutProperties list to ViewTransitionProtocol, which allows a transition to specify which layout properties should be cached and reset when the transition is complete. This allows developers to adjust or animate unrelated layout properties during a transition.
Improves the warnings in SC.RecordArray to be more meaningful and debug-mode only.
Fixes syntax problem in design mode that put undefined class names into views.
Tweaks descriptions of several DateTime record attribute unit tests.
When reading a SC.DateTime record attribute, the convertion of a null value, should produce null in all cases, not only for non unix time attributes.
Tweaks comments on range observer fix.

Fix the content change notofications for array controller using orderBy.
If the controller is sorted (via an orderBy) and new items are added, the ordered sequence may change so we need to trigger a notification for a full UI refresh. If only removing items (added == 0), the order of remaining elements is not changing therefore no need to perform such a full refresh
Adds unit test to verify #1153 bug with ArrayController range observer + orderBy.
Fixes left over unit tests for design modes API changes.
Refactors the design mode API to support orientation as well as the arbitrary application of any design mode specific properties (e.g. isVisible or rowHeight).

Removes the false assumption that non-iOS, non-touch event supported content doesn’t have any orientation. This allows orientation specific designs even on desktop (i.e. resizable) browsers. Renames the orientation body classes to ‘sc-portrait’ and ‘sc-landscape’ since they are being applied by SproutCore.

Also serves up @2x stylesheets when the devicePixelRatio is greater than 1, so devices that have a DPR or 1.5 get scaled down 2x graphics rather than scaled up 1x graphics. This matches the way that SC.Module serves stylesheets as well.
Adds a necessary run loop for assigning the new design mode on resize events.
Fixes bug if no newAdjustment exists but we are unsetting a previous adjustment for design modes.
Improves design modes documentation and binds the current design mode back to the application.
Removes observation of designModes on SC.Application.  These should just be set one time or else not used at all and we can do without the binding.
Fixes design mode tests to match the updated API.
Tidies whitespace.
Adds design mode(s) tests (currently failing - to be updated to new API).

Refactors design mode out of SC.Pane and into SC.Application.

- This makes it easy to set designModes only once per application, instead of having to set it over and over per pane.
- Also fixes application of design mode to take into account the mode that the view may already be in and thus we can exit early.
- Switches designLayouts to designAdjustments, so that you don't have to set a full layout for each mode.
Removes leftover code.

Adds design modes support to SC.Pane, allowing the design of an application to very efficiently and easily change depending on the width of the display.

While a design may be flexible for a wide range of display widths, at a certain point it no longer makes sense to keep stretching or compressing views and instead it is better to completely alter the design.  A prime example is that a design that can flex between a medium sized display like a tablet and a large sized display like a desktop, will not likely work for a small display like a smartphone.  In order to very easily alter the design, SC.Pane provides the designModes property which includes the width thresholds that you want to trigger a change to the overall design of the application.  Each time a threshold width is crossed, the child views will be updated with the new design mode.  At this point, any properties dependent on 'designMode' will recompute allowing you to adjust settings such as isVisible.

As well, SC.View has a new property 'designLayouts' that is simply the layouts for the 'designModes' you define.  For example, if the design mode becomes 'small' any child view that has a 'small' designLayout will have its layout automatically set.

This completes work spec #843.
Fixes an issue where custom transition plugins still call didTransitionIn/didTransitionOut even if a transition was cancelled.

Fixes regression that the icon of the selected item doesn’t update the view.
Adds ability to set the value of the view and have the view’s title and icon update.
Fixes a bug where separator items gained the value of the previous item such that the separator item would appear selected in the menu when the previous item was actually selected.
Adds unit test showing that value changes don’t update the title or icon.
Fixes RootResponder data-drag unit test to conform to final design. Oops
Renames draggable pane mixin. Tweaks documentation and comments to make it clear that we're not handling the edge case of panes which appendTo elements other than the body.
Improves console trace formatting for long lists of before and after states.

Prevents bindings that are disconnected at the moment of updating from continuing, which would throw an exception because the binding would try to resolve both sides of the connection and become connected to the window (which doesn’t support the KVC methods the binding uses).

One scenario that this has been seen in is an observer that destroys an old binding and creates a new binding to a *store query based computed property*.  As the binding is about to update, it first has to get the value of the query based computed property from the target, which results in the store flushing and indicating certain records did change which in turn triggers the original observer function where the binding is replaced. In the very next step, the old binding, which is now disconnected, tries to syncronize its value, which will fail.
Cleans per jshint.
Removes double clone of observable members array. The `getMembers` function already does a slice of the array, so SC.clone (which just does another slice of the array) is unnecessary.
Uses the console for debugging of observers since SC.Logger is not available for the SC.Observable mixin (SC.Logger extends SC.Object, which mixes in SC.Observable).
Improves the tracing for statecharts by using console styling and indicating when states are entered by route or not.
Cleans whitespace.
Makes SC.Pane#sendEvent's second (evt) argument optional.
Adds documentation to SC.View for the new data-drag events, as well as mouse move, click, touch and keyboard events.
Adds unit tests for RootResponder's data-drag events et al.
Adds RootResponder support for browser data drag event.

Removes canceled flag and dev warning when an invisible view is animated.

Note for future reference that although an adjusted-instantly animation was not cancelled, it wasn't run normally either, and we may want to come up with a way to alert callbacks to this.
Removes an unused variable
Fixes regression with transitionIn due to animate rejecting non-visible states.

Adds a new state to the view statechart, SC.CoreView.ATTACHED_SHOWN_ANIMATING. This state is for views that are manually animated via a call to `animate` when in the ATTACHED_SHOWN state and is used to cancel manual animations if a view is hidden or removed, which would cause the animation callbacks to fail to trigger. Also prevents animate from running on views that are not visible in the window. Also fixed double invokeNext call when runAnimationCallback is wrapped in an invokeNext.
Updates the debugging strings to include the object identifier to ensure that the instance being logged is not a duplicate of another instance.

Brings back new record support again for SC.ManyArray, but only manually. Adds the updateNewRecordId to manually update the many array when the new record is ready. In the future this should be automatic, but it has to also work across nested stores.
Scales back the error message length so that it doesn’t get truncated in the console.
Reverts new record support for SC.ManyArray. This fails to work with nested stores and needs to be rethought at a deeper level in concert with the store.
Fixes direct duplicate call to commitEditing in SC.InlineTextField when using the tab or shift-tab keys, also cleans whitespace in SC.Editable.
Cancels show/hide transitions when the state changes before they complete.
If the transition is cancelled, the plugin should not fire the callback.
Updates the Showcase submodule.
Fixes up the unit tests.
Changes the API property to supportNewRecords (hopefully clearer), makes it true by default (hopefully easier to use) and adds more documentation around it.
Improves jsdocs.
Fixes a typo that prevented the record from being properly dirtied on changes.
Makes the transient record support voluntary and adds unit tests.
Fixes a problem where the storeId would get updated even though the record doesn’t have an id yet.
Fixes an exception when removing an added transient item before it has a valid id.

Allows transient (i.e. no id) records to be added to an SC.ManyArray by using a temporary placeholder key and avoiding dirtying the owning record until after the related record is saved and has an id assigned.

Fixes bugs where logic bindings (and & or) defined on classes were being serviced by a shared underlying object, causing issues when two instances wanted different values or to be destroyed at different times.
Adds unit tests showing bugs with logic bindings (and & or) defined on classes.
Fixes a bug where collection view group-vs-item classes were not being swapped on pooled views.
Adds unit tests showing bug with SC.CollectionView group-vs-item classes.
Improves readability of statechart trace before & after state lists.

SC.MenuItemView: Add a right arrow when a subMenu is defined

Merge pull request #1136 from mirion/mirion_dev/view_auto_mixins_rev

Integrate the SC.AutoMixin into SC.view, using a new property: autoMixins. Deprecate SC.AutoMixin

Merge pull request #1135 from mirion/mirion_dev/stack_layouts_resize_to_fit

Stacked child layout views + resizeToFit: don't add padding or margins if none of the children is visible
Integrate the SC.AutoMixin into SC.view, using a new property: autoMixins. Deprecate SC.AutoMixin
Fixes animations failing when browser tab not visible.

Takes a new approach to transition and animation callbacks. Instead of waiting for the exact right event name to be determined, we listen to all the possible combinations for the browser and then remove the unnecessary listeners when the test completes. This allows code to run that uses transitions and animations in the application’s main function and doesn’t require blocking the launch of the application for the tests to complete.

Fixes animations failing when tab loaded and not visible. Because animation callbacks are paused when some browsers’ tabs are not visible, we can’t apply animations based on the browser support for CSS transitions alone. We also need to set up our animation event listeners and so any animations that occur while the page is loading should simply apply directly.
Stacked child layout views: dont add padding or margins if none of the children in svisible

Fixes the case that a layout observer calls adjust due to an animate layout being set. The observer would fire before the _animateLayout internal property would be cleared, leading a later adjust method to fail.
Implements image view fix that didn't make it into d662191 for some reason.
Fixes image unit tests introduced in d715483 to actually test the bug.

Improves developer warning when binding to non-observable objects. Implements a special-case warning for a common mistake (missing leadoff periods on local binding paths) with unintuitive symptoms (tries to bind to non-observable 'window').
Remove the right childViews observer on destroyMixin

Removes (apparently) misguided comment.

Comments in the render delegate suggest that useCanvas: YES wasn't meant to be used with CSS values, but there doesn't seem to be a functional reason to force devs to learn this magic property combination.

Actually fixes regression in SC.TextFieldView.

Adds unit tests to childViewLayout

Fixes regression in childViewLayout

Regression introduced by this commit:
https://github.com/sproutcore/sproutcore/commit/ea620753a313f085460de2ba
9eae3c7fe7368d87
