Refactors SC.SceneView to match the new SC.ContainerView

Improves the SC.ContainerView transition plugin support. Plugins can now provide reversable support for when the same view changes from entering to exiting or vice versa. Also fixes a problem with the REVEAL transition resetting content after removal and adds SC.ContainerContentStatechart debugging support via SC.LOG_CONTAINER_CONTENT_STATES.
Fixes the private liveAdjustments property of SC.View so that it returns left/top values for live transform adjustments that are less than or equal zero.
Adds test showing an issue when changing nowshowing during a transition
Brings back jshint cleanup that was lost in rebase.

Add support for text field autocompletion

Adds an 'autoComplete' attribute to TextFieldView. Set to YES or NO to
enable or disable autocompletion. If set to 'null', the browser uses system
defaults. The default value is 'null' so that backward compatibility is
maintained.
Tidies per jshint.
Fixes whitespace.
Removes items as a display property since it is being observed separately and render is no longer used to update the items.

Adds unit tests proving the existence of the bug noted in #999.

Bring SC.AutoMixin at the same level as the main createChildView.
Fix the AutoMixin to use for each child view a clear clone of autoMixins.
Fixes inaccurate comment.
Enables locally-scoped 'and' & 'or' bindings. Fixes #989.
Fixes improper unit tests. There’s no real reason why the disabled and readonly attributes need to be mutually exclusive even if it doesn’t make sense to disable a readonly text field.
Fixes a regression from previous commit that accidentally commented out a necessary function.
Fixes a regression from previous commit that failed to include the disabled attribute on initial render of an SC.TextFieldView.
Cleans per jshint.
Fixes a problem when the initial isEnabled value of a view is false that failed to update the isEnabledInPane value of that view and its child views. Includes unit tests.
Fixes the problem that changing the isEnabled value of a view which had disabled ancestors could change the value of isEnabledInPane for the view to an improper value.

Cleans up the code of SC.TextFieldView and SC.FieldView slightly. Notably removing double attempt to set disabled attribute on the input inside SC.TextFieldView (it’s set by SC.Control) and not setting the mouse state flag and becoming first resonder on mouse down when the text field view is disabled and not notifying that the selection has changed on mouse up when the text field view is disabled.
Uses isEnabledInPane of SC.Control mixin to determine whether to add disabled attributes to the input field or not.
Cleans SC.TextFieldView.

Merge pull request #926 from nicolasbadia/popup-touch

Add support for touch events to SC.PopupButtonView.
Adds unit tests to verify the bug fixed by #1126 / #886. BOOM!
Removes the redundant fix up text layout call from didCreateLayer.
Fixes a regression where tree item observers’ delegates were forced to specify treeItemChildrenKey and treeItemIsExpandedKey. If the delegate doesn’t provide these properties, the defaults are used.
Fixes regression that prevents developers from setting IDs the usual way.
Adds some documentation to TreeItemObserver explaining what will and won't get observed in tree-data-type terms.

Moves SC.View#animate's adjust-on-zero-duration call to the next runloop.

All animations begin after the end of the current runloop; zero-duration animations should be no different, even if we're using the underlying adjust code instead.
Improves the delegate and item handling of SC.TreeItemObserver. Includes unit tests.

Chrome has gotten uppity about using evt.returnValue, throwing a deprecation warning, so this gates the use of it to instances when evt.preventDefault is not found (IE8 and lower, see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ff975967).
Fixes regression in TreeItemObserver for determining indexes in sub-observer children.
Made the previousKeyPanes list docs private. Added a note documenting its minor leak, and justification for not fixing it.
Further fixes for regressions in SC.TreeItemObserver.
Fixes syntax errors and cleans file so jshint is usable.

Improves the performance and code structure of SC.TreeItemObserver and SC.TreeController. Previously, the tree observer process was extremely inefficient. For one, the tree controller constantly destroyed and recreated item observer instances whenever its content changed. For another, the item observer observed all properties of its items so any property change (even those not associated with tree item content) would cause the item observer to check for changes to the item’s expanded state or children.

For example, in a current app with a one level deep tree of tree branches, the old code created 25 tree item observers and destroyed 21 for a total of 4 actual item observers. The new code simply creates 4 actual item observers one time!
Removes errors that will appear in development from production builds.
Tidies whitespace and adds extra computed property test to validate SC.ObjectController changing content to null.
Fixes regression in collection views so that they properly re-render when inside nested scroll views.
complete ListItemView implementation and add support for right icon action/target
Adds unit tests for the new isLast item view property for SC.CollectionView items.
Fixes unit tests for run loop execution and cleanliness.

Turns the TestRunner unit test name into a clickable link to open the direct test in another window/tab. This makes it easy to go to a particular unit test that needs more work in order to debug more effectively without having to remember the special path.
Disables the selectstart catch all for the unit tests, but doesn’t unload all event handling which can cause exceptions when trying to do event testing.
Removes a duplicate listener on ‘selectstart’ events. It is handled separately in the code below.
Adds the `isLast` property to item views that are the last in the collection. Takes care of the case where a new item is added to the end, such that the previous last item also updates.

New SC.WebSocket class

Removes the jQuery ready hold in SC.platform that was used to delay launching of the app until the transition and animation event names tests completed. Several browsers will not run the transition/animations in hidden tabs, which slows and possibly blocks an app from launching. Since the results of these tests are used only to optimize the event listeners set up in SC.RootResponder, the code has been changed to setup the root responder at whatever point the tests successfully finish. Closes #1120
Adds a Developer Error when attempting to add records without ids to relationships.
Adds debug-mode only informative toString method to SC.ManyArray.

Adds a debug-mode only developer error to prevent double calls to materializeRecord from within materializeRecord. The result is duplicated objects that appear to be the same record instance but are in fact not, which can be very time-consuming to debug. Hopefully this saves developers a lot of grief.
Switches to smaller test images in stalling unit test.
Adds several *debug-mode only* `toString` methods for easy debugging.
Adds an observer to SC.PickerPane border frames so that the pane will re-position if it changes size. Should fix #1034.
Cleans as per jshint.
Fixes the appearance of an `undefined` attribute in SC.TextFieldView.

Adds a tiny bit of debug mode only developer support. If manually connecting/disconnecting bindings it's possible to accidentally try to bind to a missing object. The normal stack trace this would produce is hard to follow so we present a more traceable error message with the stack.

Corrects the previous memory leak fix. We should not remove the shared callback function until all events are removed from the element.
Fixes a memory leak in SC.Event that failed to clear out cached event listeners.
Destroys the inline text field when it is released, preventing a memory leak as noted in #935.
Improves SC.SplitView documentation.
Small docs correction for SC.Enumerable
Generate documentation for experimental FormRowView
Updates for 1.10.1
Moves `findClassNames` function into the SC object. NOTE: this method will be made into a debug mode only method in the future as it should not be used in production. Closes #978

Fixes bug with SC.ContentValueSupport when removing old content observers
Fixes layout bug with label view editor in STACK layout plugins. Fixes #1112.

Fixes SC.Module loading on IE11+
Fixes broken grid drag-drop unit test.

This prevents additional observers from being added to views that don't support calculatedHeight or calculatedWidth and prevents additional frame observers for being added to collection views, which reduces the duplicate calls to SC.ScrollView's contentViewFrameDidChange."

This reverts commit a7c8c6adb72a3172ad2bfdf4323943ace255f03f.

Removes dragExited method from CollectionView.

With the SC.Drag refactor now correctly calling dragEnded after dragExited (see SC.Drag docs; 5be078c), CollectionView no longer needs to remove the insertion point on both events.
Forgot to pass dragOp parameter
Added unit tests to ensure that dragEnded is call when a drag is cancel

SC.Drag refactor

SC.Drag now fire dragEnded when cancelling a drag and drop operation
using the escape key:
https://github.com/sproutcore/sproutcore/issues/513

Also fix a possible memory leak with the _cachedDropTargets property.
Reverts removal of forced calculatedHeight/calculatedWidth implementation in collection view subclasses.
Adds @2x version for menu pane. Also tells drop-shadow to "chill out" to match panel pane.
Removes forced requirement for subclasses of SC.CollectionView to implement calculatedHeight and calculatedWidth.
Fixes failing unit test.
Restore _scfl_childViewsDidChange for backward compatibility.

CollectionView: fix the selection on touchEnd. Previously when an item was touched two times, after the second touch it was no longer marked as selected even if it was (correctly) part of the collection's selection, its isSelected property was NO when it was supposed to be YES. Added also a test sequence for collection touch events (covers this bug too).

Fixes the code to show an insertion point for SC.GridView using @nicolasbadia's code. Adds a default style for SC.GridView's default insertion point that matches SC.ListView's default. Also improves the positioning of SC.ListView's insertion point so that the insertion view can specify a different height/right/width layout if wanted.

Reapplies the CSS transforms when touch scroll view's content frame changes. Because the CSS transforms are applied directly to the content view, if the content view's layout style changes, the transforms will be erased. Fixes #949.

Fine tunes the content view observers in SC.ScrollView. This prevents additional observers from being added to views that don't support calculatedHeight or calculatedWidth and prevents additional frame observers for being added to collection views, which reduces the duplicate calls to SC.ScrollView's contentViewFrameDidChange.

Removes the necessity to trigger run loops while the scroll decelerates and only triggers the run loop when actually doing an update. This also removes an invoke warning if the first time the deceleration code runs (not within run loop) and doesn't have any velocity and so updates immediately.

Changes the theme class for SC.EmptyTheme from 'sc-empty' to 'sc-empty-theme'. This fixes the conflict with 'sc-empty' used by SC.ProgressViews that causes all progress views in apps using the empty theme to not have an inner border. This is a potentially conflicting change, but less dangerous than changing the class used by SC.ProgressView, because SC.EmptyTheme doesn't have any styles. Fixes #936

Merge pull request #900 from FernCreek/patch/fairbanksg/handlebars-escaping

Resolved Handlebars escaping issue with ampersands.
Clean ups and starting run loops for unit tests.
Removes some internal classes from the docs.
Corrects the RunLoop documentation.
Cleans per jshint.
Fixes a bug in ContentValueSupport where _old_contentValueKeys, if it were a string, would not be removed.
Fixes regression with os sniffing of Linux and Android.
Updates Changelog for 1.10.0

Removes the blockers that prevented all browsers that support touch events from using mouse events. Note: a browser's support of touch events is no indication of a touch capable device or even that the touch capable device will not need to send mouse events (via a plugged in mouse for example). When implementing touch support in a custom control, you should call evt.preventDefault in touchEnd to prevent additional mouse events from being sent by the browser.

Prevents extremely bizarre bug where an iPad will fail to detect the os in iOS, in spite of following the correct code path. The correct value is assigned to an array and then re-read from the same array a moment later. For some unknown reason, when the value is re-read from the array it would return the old value. Side effects of this are that all hacks looking for mobile safari would fail (including touch handling in text fields).
Adds user agent test for iOS 7 on iPad.
Updates Showcase submodule.
Improve the performance of the small list in the Welcome app by turning off incremental rendering.

Starts run loops for SC.ScrollView touch drag and deceleration handling. Deceleration uses requestAnimationFrame to do calculations (outside the run loop), but the display update isn't raw so we need to start a run loop for the display to properly update.
Fixes a regression in SC.ScrollView that threw an exception when beginning a new touch drag while a previous one was still decelerating.
Adds touch events to the array of "basic" events in SC.RootResponder. This removes the need for two separate array instances and touch is a basic event.
Fixes a failing unit test.

Removes try/catch blocks from the animation and transtion event handlers. These hurt the performance of the event handling and don't provide significant value (if any value at all, since the exception is still thrown).
Allows adjust to be called after animate in the same run loop. Adjust can occur cleanly, which won't affect the animation or it can clash, in which case it will stop the animation.

Replaces several instances of deleted properties to null outs instead. Apparently JS engines can detect and optimize "hot" objects as long as their structure doesn't change too much, which delete would do. Reference: http://coding.smashingmagazine.com/2012/11/05/writing-fast-memory-efficient-javascript/
Adds tests for calling adjust after animate in the same run loop.

Fixes a problem which kept firstObject and lastObject referenced from an array controller from updating on replace. Also fixes a problem updating lastObject on an enumerable when replacing the last items and shrinking the collection. Closes #979, closes #980.
Adds unit test proving #979.
Fixes a problem when using an SC.SplitView as a split child.
Fixes a bug that updating the parent record data hash failed to update the nested record hashes as well.
Cleans up unit test a bit.
Fixes problems with SC.TemplateCollectionView and new view statechart structure.
Tidies SC.ScrollView a bit.
Fixes a problem with SC.ScrollView that required an additional frame change notification to work previously, but seems to be just improper initialization of the view.

Reverses the previous: Fixes the case where child views are created as part of the parent view (thus shortcutting the statechart doAdopt call). This fixes these child views so that they also check for resize when adopted.
This shouldn't be necessary and results in an extra frame change notification, which we don't want.
Cleans up scroll view tests further.
Cleans up unit tests.
Fixes the case where child views are created as part of the parent view (thus shortcutting the statechart doAdopt call). This fixes these child views so that they also check for resize when adopted.
Fixes some legacy unit tests.
Fixes an incorrect unit test (you're not allowed to append a view to the document, only panes).

Fixes a problem where the didCreateLayer callback fires before the view state has been updated. Notably, the improvements to viewDidResize efficiency made this suddenly a problem for SC.ImageView canvas updating.
Fixes an improper unit test.
Updates unit test to pass.
Fixes a problem where childViews incorrectly called viewDidResize one extra time when appended to the DOM. The views will already have run viewDidResize once on being adopted by a parentView.

Fixes a miscalculation of isFixedPosition that resulted in incorrect values when short form layouts were used (ex. specifying { width: 10, height: 10 } only which implies top: 0 and left: 0). This would have caused such views to return false for hasAcceleratedLayer even though they had set wantsAcceleratedLayer to true.
Adds unit tests for isFixedLayout through isFixedSize and isFixedPosition.

Prevents needless view updates when displayDidChange is called on an unrendered view. Normally, the actual update code handles the check to see if the view is rendered and can be updated, but if displayDidChange comes before a render, we would end up rendering and then updating. Now it checks to see if the view is rendered before attempting to update it at all. Fixes 1 unit test from #1082.
Adds debugging statements to SC.View statechart.  Available for core devs via SC.LOG_VIEW_STATES = true;
Cleans whitespace.

Fixes a potentially huge memory leak when views that mix in SC.ContentValueSupport (or via SC.Control) will not remove all the content value observers from the content object when the view is destroyed. One result is that every time you scrolled a list of SC.ListItemViews back and forth it was appending more and more observers to the content.
Tidies the unit test file.
Give SC.InlineTextFieldView a default layout size of 0x0 so that it doesn't alter the scrollTop/scrollLeft of a parent view layer that allows overflow.
Adds cleanup and more accurate setup to unit test.
Cleans a la jshint.
Removes old SC.SplitView unit tests that don't work properly and are already covered by the new unit tests.
Corrects the documentation for SC.TableView — next step, actually rewrite SC.TableView. Fixes #1079 once the docs are rebuilt for 1.10.0.rc.3/1.10.0

Reverts prevention of changing the picker position when the anchor has a positon of 0,0. This was added way back in 2010 with the comment “Also check if the anchor provided gives rect with x as 0 and y as 0.In which case we should not tamper with the current structure of the picker”, but a lot has changed since then and it's unclear what purpose it serves. Closes #1060.

fix unit test, partially reverting fc86ca0ca9df73934ffc09c4539b6fe8e465acdf
Updates a unit test to remove references to code that no longer exists.
Removes additional redundant observer on SC.ListView.
Updates the collection fast path unit test to be more accurate and work properly.
Adds cleanup to several unit tests in order to avoid leftover views from corrupting later tests.
Removes the long deprecated SC.Border mixin.  This capability was brought into SC.View several versions ago.

Fixes the _doRender method of the view to not attempt to attach to a parent if the parent isn't rendered.  Solves the case of rendering a child view before the parent itself is rendered.  Fixes failing unit tests.
Moves isVisible & isFirstResponder observers into rendered state rather than attached state so that we can queue visibility changes when rendered but unattached.  Includes passing unit test.
comment explaining the regex and unit test
use a smarter regex when escaping html entities (<>&): avoid escaping valid html character entities like &

FIx the FlowedLayout. Replace the "childViews" observer by another one on "childViews.[]". This was necessary because when adding children to the FlowedLayout, the added children were not positioned correctly (the observer not being triggered).
Fixes FlowedLayout unit tests.
Fixes problems with transitionAdjust by removing additional view state modification.
Fixes problem when changing the paddingAfter in Vertical and Horizontal layout plugins.
Adds support for modifying the childViews array and updating the child view layout.
Adds SC.View.HORIZONTAL_STACK child layout plugin.
Adds transitionAdjust support to transition layout changes.
Improvements to child view layouts and VERTICAL_STACK plugin.
Adds initial work in progress.
Fixes a bug that caused the drop target to have dragExited called when the drag ends and also improves the ghostView layout to match the actual size of the drag view.
Removes queueing of visible state changes based on isVisible, this caused the state to lag the isVisible property and other state changes that occur in the meantime would be incorrect.
Updates Showcase submodule.

Passes the value of `wantsAcceleratedLayer` from the source view to the ghost view in SC.Drag allowing the ghost view layer to be positioned using transforms which are HW accelerated on some platforms.
Removes unnecessary extra call to update layout in SC.Drag ghost view positioning.
Cleans a la jshint.
Fixes regression in SC.CollectionView dragging, which prevented the dragView from appearing.  This extra call to create a layer is no longer needed because of the view statechart.
Fixes bug preventing cancelling in place for CSS transform animations.  Updated unit test.

Adds support for automatically animating margin-left and margin-top when centerX or centerY layouts are used and the height or width changes.  This makes centered height and width animations smooth.  Includes unit test.
Fixes animation bug where animating multiple keys in which some do not actually change value resulted in leftover animation styles.  Includes unit test.
Fixes SC.View#animate to work with centerX & centerY.  You can now animate `centerX` and `centerY` adjustments.
Tidies the code a bit.
Removes code that was accidentally committed.
Fixes regression where newly added child views failed to update their frame properties.
Removes code that was accidentally committed.
Fixes failing unit test since the original xBinding property is no longer left on the object after initialization.
Pushes updated failing (yet correct) unit test that shows how '@each' does NOT work correctly as a dependent property path.

Fixes a bug where adding a child view to a rendered and unattached parent failed to attach the child view to the parent and also turns off optimizations in removeAllChildren and replaceAllChildren because they improperly notify removal/destroying/creating/appending of the view and can result in duplicate layers for the view.  These optimizations will have to be revisited to completely bypass the statechart.
Patches the platform support for "touch".  Closes #1007.
Tidies whitespace.

Fixes polymorphic records so that you can change the id on the record.  Previously, this would result in broken storeKey caches on the polymorphic superclasses, so the same record would appear with different ids depending on which class it is requested with.
Adds a unit test showing that changing the id on a polymorphic record fails.
Adds UNATTACHED_BY_PARENT state to represent a child view of an UNATTACHED parent.  You can detach an UNATTACHED_BY_PARENT view, while you can't detach an UNATTACHED view.
Updates the deprecation warning.

Refactors the SC.PickerPane positioning code for SC.PICKER_POINTER and SC.MENU_POINTER.

This code was essentially unreadable and did not even really work.  There were lots of odd constants that affected the positioning and placement in strange ways.  With this refactor, the picker pane properly positions itself on the most appropriate side and will slide itself up/down or left/right if it can in order to fit.

- adds ability for pointer to automatically adjust its position as the pane shifts left/right or up/down regardless of its size
- fixes pane positioning to take into account the borderFrame
- adds private `windowPadding` property that ensures pickers are positioned a certain amount of distance from all edges of the screen
- deprecates the extraRightOffset property since the pointer positions itself
- fixes bug with render delegate that left the position class on the view after it changed
Adds retina versions of huge button, panel background and picker pointers.
Tidies white space.

Adds an '[]' observer to the array when an '@each.key' observer is used.  Previously, changes to the array's membership would noisily call propertyDidChange while setting up key observers on each additional item.  This change gets rid of this shotgun approach that resulted in multiple fires of the observer when adding multiple new items to the array.  It also fixes the problem that removing items from the array also failed to call a change to the array.

Gives SC.TreeController the jshint treatment and also adds the arrangedObjects observer on demand, which removes the need for a chained observer (== slightly less memory, faster).

Makes SC.ToolbarView more intelligent about it's styling: not just styled appropriately for top alignment, layout adjusted to include a top or bottom border.  Also improves class documentation.

SC.Observable defines a helper method `getEach` for getting properties on a single object.  This conflicts with SC.Enumerable's `getEach`, which means that you can't call getEach on an SC.Set like you would on an SC.Array implementation.  Instead, when mixing in SC.Enumerable and SC.Observable to SC.Set, we should mix in SC.Observable first, so that SC.Enumerable's version of `getEach` wins.

Includes unit test.
Fixes update of child view state dependent on the child's state, not its isVisible property (which doesn't accurately represent its state).
Fixes missed optimization, where replacing the children of a view attempted to re-attach the view twice.
Removes unused property.

Ties all the event handling for views to isEnabledInPane, which will be false if the view is disabled or any ancestor of the view is disabled.
Removes all redundant isEnabled display property observers and render code.  This is already part of SC.View.

Reworks the isEnabled addition in order to allow for the enabled state to actively cascade to child views.  While you could previously use the `isEnabledInPane` property to determine if any ancestor view had been disabled, it was lazily computed and not bindable.  With this change, `isEnabledInPane` is updated actively, which means that it can be used to update the child view's display if wanted.  For example, a view gets the 'disabled' class if isEnabled is set to false, but it can also add isEnabledInPane as a displayProperty and use it to appear disabled if any ancestor becomes disabled.

This cascading can be blocked by any child view by setting `shouldInheritEnabled` to false, which allows you to set isEnabled on the top pane, but keep a section of child views separately enabled.

Includes unit tests.  Closes #638.
Tidies up some internal method names to make it easier to remember their purpose.

Fixes from the Office for Prevention of Redundancy Office: the 'focus' and 'disabled' classes are set accordingly on all SC.View subclasses.  This removes yet one more display observer from SC.CollectionView.
Changes the currentState property of SC.View to viewState to avoid conflicts with other statecharts layered on top, such as objectState and enabledState.
Adds rotate and scale property support to SC.stringFromLayout.

Adds SC.View.POP transition, refactors the transition states of SC.View to handle changes in state in order to flip a transition animation smoothly and adds support for cancelling rotation or scale animations in place.
Forces the order of transform attributes so that the scale is last so that we can decompose the transformation matrix.
Fixes typo in method name.
Fixes regression with img based images that failed to insert a placeholder img tag when no value is set initially.
Ensures that detached child views also execute queued updates when their parent is re-attached.
Removes unneeded code and unnecessary DOM manipulation, since the canvas render delegate can support the CSS type too now.
Fixes regression that failed to clear canvas based image views when the value goes to null.
Prevents problems with erasing class names when switching between CSS and URL image types.
Fixes regression in SC.ImageButtonView that caused the sc-view class to be removed.
Removes two display observers from SC.ImageView and drops undocumented support for setting the value of an image as an array (which was parsed out into a single value for some reason.
Adds support for sprite images based on canvas.  This fixes a bug when changing between a sprite and a URL type with the same image that created duplicate elements in the DOM.
Fixes broken unit tests from changing foundation images + adds new unit test for bug in images that switch type between CSS and URL.
Moves a debug statement into debug-only mode.
Updates Showcase submodule.
Removes some ugly unused images from the foundation framework and adds updated sproutcore assets which are more useful.
Renames SC.FILL_PROPORTIONALLY to SC.BEST_FILL.  SC.FILL_PROPORTIONALLY is still supported but no longer documented.
Fixes collection view to respect the value of isEditable to prevent deletes and reorders as the documentation says.
Indicates that SC.ListItemView and SC.MenuItemView are not updatable in place.  Closes #984
Fixes broken unit tests.

Fixes improper forced update in place of collection items when reloading specific indexes.  Not all item views will be reusable and so it shouldn't assume that the view can just be reconfigured.  Also simplifies the code down to several fewer lines and fixes improper unit tests.
Fixes broken unit test.
Adds unit tests for new isDeletable, isEditable & isReorderable item view support.

Adds isEditable, isDeletable and isReorderable support for item views.  The previous docs indicated that if isEditable of the collection was true, it would set the property on the item views.  This was not the case, so there wasn't any way to have a list of items switch between a display mode to an editable mode.  This change uses canEditContent, canDeleteContent and canReorderContent to indicate whether to add the respective properties to the item views.  For example, this allows you to toggle canReorderContent to hide or show a drag handle on item views that have isReorderable as a display property.

Note: Setting isEditable to false on the collection view overrides the three other properties.
Removes the short form xBinding properties from the object, since when they are created they are added to the bindings Array on the object, which is properly cleaned up on destroy.
Cleans file according to jshint.
Fixes some of the comments and jsdocs.

Tidies up a tiny bit, isolates debug mode only code and starts a run loop when mouseUp is sent to a drag view.  Also when mouseUp is sent to a drag view, it doesn't call sendEvent for the mouseUp & click events on the drag view also.
Tidies white space and improves jsdoc argument names.

Fully deprecates SC.InlineTextField class methods, which were labeled as "should no longer be used".  This should make inline text field debugging easier to do.
Updates the new transitions to match the new API.
Fixes regression when transition API changed to calling cancelIn/cancelOut.
Moves all tracing code in SC.State within debug mode only, which removes several lines of code and an observer from production builds.
Moves all tracing code in SC.Statechart within debug mode only, which removes several lines of code and an observer from production builds.
Tidies code via jshint.
Tidies code via jshint.
Removes benchmarking code from non-debug builds.
Also escapes the tool tip for SC.LabelView, which could also be a potential avenue of attack for XSS.
Removes dependencies on deprecated textAlign property.

Removes excess display property observers from SC.ButtonView (escapeHTML, needsEllipsis, tooltip) and SC.LabelView (escapeHTML, textAlign, fontWeight, needsEllipsis).  In the case of escapeHTML and needsEllipsis, these are used in the update rendering, but it seems highly unlikely that the value will need to change on the fly.  The docs have been updated to indicate how to support updating these values on the fly if necessary though.  In the case of the other properties, they no longer exist on the views.
Removes meaningless property from SC.ButtonView.
Fixes broken unit test for SC.ButtonView.
Fully deprecates the fontWeight attribute of SC.LabelView.
Removes several lines of statechart debugging code from non-debug builds.
Cleans up code for jshint.
Removes three extra observers from SC.ButtonView instances by using existing observers to also call displayDidChange.
Removes isEnabled displayProperty from SC.Control and instead makes it an effective display property of all SC.Views by calling displayDidChange in the existing isEnabled observer on all SC.Views.

Removes the restriction that render delegate data sources can only retrieve displayProperties properties.  This restriction is not especially helpful, but worse than that, it forces us to have excess display properties, which means excess observers being set up and running although not every property that effects the display necessarily needs to be observed.  For example, SC.ButtonView has several internal observers on properties that are also display properties.  It's more efficient to use those same observers to call displayDidChange and not have the properties also be display properties.

Removes backgroundColor observer from all SC.Views.  If anyone actually uses this property AND needs it to update, they'll have to add the displayProperty themselves.  There's no reason every other view in every other app needs this.
Makes the string from layout and string from rect output a bit easier to read.
Prevents exception when clicking on a collection without any content.

Fixes SC.ImageButtonView to actually apply the image class to the wrapper div, thus removing the extra internal div and allowing the .active class to work like the docs say.  Previously, there was no way to get an active version of the image used without also adding a custom class name to the button + the docs said you could and were wrong.
Updates the disabled class for isEnabled changes without making isEnabled a display property (fucking render delegates…)

Fixes SC.CollectionView to reload when isEnabled changes.  Otherwise, the isEnabled property isn't reset on the item views to match the value of the view itself.  This was done by observing isEnabled separately from the other displayProperties so that we can also call reload().

Adds unit test showing that collections don't reload when isEnabled changes like they should.
Also fixes unit tests since view refactor.
Adds 'sc-item' class to non-group collection items.  Otherwise, you can apply styles to groups, to items and groups, but not items individually without adding class names to the exampleView.
Fixes regression in SC.CollectionView and ensures that child views notify willShowInDocument, didShowInDocument, willHideInDocument and didHideInDocument appropriately.
Improves jsdocs a tiny bit.
Fixes jsdoc reference

Fixes building out transition so that a parent will wait for all children transitions to complete before finally detaching.  This makes it simple to add a number of transitionOut plugins and only remove the topmost view (probably a pane) rather than have to remove each child in order to see the transitions.
Removes recurse argument from private _callOnChildViews.  Every use of the method so far is always the same.

Adds much more rigor to the view states.  Now if the view is in any of the transitioning states, it can handle many more events such as state changes of the parent.  As well, views can transition out in a group without having to have the parent observe every child with a transitionOut plugin.  Updates unit tests.
Adds new states necessary to reflect the state of child views being affected by their parent views.
Major update to transition state handling to hopefully include all possible states (as parent or as child)

Changes SC.CoreView state constants into individual constants rather than part of an enum-like object.  Enums are nicer since you can indicate them as the type and document them as such, but… it's an extra object in the class and an extra property to have to type and look-up over and over.  Also switches the states to Numbers that are spaced out to allow for bitwise comparisons to determine states (a la SC.Record).  Adds IS_CREATED, IS_RENDERED, IS_ATTACHED and IS_SHOWN pseudo-states for quick comparisons with the current state.
Uses the standard public method for easier debugging and profiling.

Optiimizes destroy of SC.View.  This is a slow part of the view lifecycle, due to recursively running through every descendant and notifying willRemoveFromParent, didRemoveFromParent, willRemoveChild, didRemoveChild as well as searching through and clearing all of the childViews arrays.  Instead, we destroy the topmost parent, including detaching and destroying the layer and clearing all references to the views from SC.View.views, but then we defer orphaning the childViews for the newly destroyed parent until the next run loop.  This cuts the destroy time almost in half for the average view tree.
Fixes the implementation of do destroy layer in view statechart to also clear all descendants' references to the shared layer.  Includes unit test.
Tidies code.

Removes _isHiddenBySelf and _isHiddenByAncestor out of production builds.
Also fixes up state inconsistencies around hiding and showing parent views in different scenarios.
Simplifies the code by making effective use of _callOnChildViews and improves the performance of _callOnChildViews.
Improves the view statechart unit tests.

- Improves the view orphaning handling, which previously would call layoutDidChange in order to determine if being orphaned caused it to be resized and it should notify its own child views that their frames may have changed too.  But by using layoutDidChange we actually run some code that thinks our layout really did change when it didn't and this will cause the layout update code to run needlessly.
Fixes regression in IE.

- Tightens up the internal view statechart code.
- Improves the view adoption handling, which previously would call layoutDidChange in order to determine if being adopted caused it to be resized and it should notify its own child views that their frames may have changed too.  But by using layoutDidChange we actually run some code that thinks our layout really did change when it didn't and this will cause the layout update code to run needlessly.
Fixes regression in SC.MenuPane due to change in SC.PickerPane.

- Renames MOVE transition to more appropriate SLIDE transition.
- Moves transition properties into SC.CoreView to get rid of extra reopen.
- Removes experimental child layout plugin support.
Improves layoutDidChange for panes to ensure that the updateLayout code is only run once per run loop.

- Removes layout observer from every SC.Pane instance and removes duplicate layout updating on panes.  SC.Pane has support for requesting that the body overflow be auto or hidden depending on the size of the pane and the window.  Only SC.MainPane should ever make use of this though and it can be done using the statechart callback methods instead of an observer.
- Fixes bug that failed to remove the request when a main pane is removed.
- Also simplifies the existing code that disables the body overflow for SC.PickerPanes and actually, you know, makes it work…
Reverts removal of default modal pane in SC.PalettePane.  Although it doesn't make sense, it kind of makes sense...
Fixes the modal pane to cover the whole screen even if scrolled.  Courtesy of @fairbanksg.  Closes #909.

Fixes regression that didn't remove combo styles.

Lengthens default bounce out transition a bit.

Makes the transition callbacks public and adds SC.TransitionProtocol.  Moves aside old transition protocol to SC.SwapTransitionProtocol.
Tidies code.
Removes the aria-hidden attribute rather than setting it to false.
Tidies a bit.
Improves setStyle in SC.RenderContext to not remove all styles in order to set the updated hash.
Notifies after updating visibility so that willShowInDocument can measure the element if necessary.
Bumps the Showcase submodule.
Improves do show and attached handling to properly update child views.
Fixes SC.ControlTestPane cleanup to destroy the pane.
Moves the layout code into SC.View's layout module, also fixes notification code arround attaching & detaching.
Fixes a problem with SC.ImageView and static layout that was hacked around and fixes a bug where starting with no value and then adding a CSS sprite value.
Updates replaceLayer to reattach when previously attached.  Also watches out for automatic attachment on creation that is done by childViews.
Fixes broken unit tests.
Fixes for SC.TemplatePoo to help it work with updated SC.CoreView.
Bumps the Showcase submodule.
Fixes SC.CollectionView itemViewForContentIndex when using the rebuild argument so that the previous item views are properly destroyed.
Adds backwards compatibility for firstTime argument in renderLayout.
Fixes bad unit tests.
Updates the statechart diagram.
Uses new willShowInWindow notification in order to remove an observer from all SC.CollectionView instances.
Improves item view pooling by shifting from the pool so that there is a good chance that the same item view will be returned for the current index that was pushed on due to a full reload.
Removes references to the deprecated SC.StaticLayout.
Replaces isShown with isVisibleInWindow, which is backwards compatible without having to do any fixups.
Fixes improper unit tests.
Fixes improper destroy call for child views.
Adds legacy support for observing layerNeedsUpdate.
Fixes improper unit tests.
Removes layer observer from SC.ImageView and use didCreateLayer callback instead.
Fixes regression in SC.ContainerView when content is null.
Fixes unit tests for SC.View refactor.
Remove debug statement.
Re-enables the layoutChildViews functionality in the layout module.  It's debatable that anyone uses this code, but maybe it will come in handy.
Fixes regression when renderChildViews is called within the render method, resulting in it being called twice.
Changes updateLayer to be a forced update as opposed to updateLayerIfNeeded, which will queue appropriately.
Improves documentation in SC.View.

Deprecates layerNeedsUpdate, layerLocationNeedsUpdate and updateLayerLocationIfNeeded.  Deprecating layerNeedsUpdate allows us to remove an extra observer on all SC.Views and the functionality is already well covered by displayDidChange, updateLayer and updateLayerIfNeeded.  The layerLocationNeedsUpdate code is handled by the statechart now.
Fixes the way that SC.PanelPane becomes/resigns key pane.

Adds `createdByParent` property that is set to true when the view was instantiated by its parent through createChildView.
Prevents memory leaks and simplifies the code of several views by using createdByParent to identify when the child view being removed was automatically created and should now be destroyed.
Improves isVisibleInWindow backwards compatibility.
Fixes docs for updated transition syntax.

Tidies SC.Pane.
Adds backwards compatibility for passing jQuery objects to appendTo and prependTo.
Makes SC.MainPane become and resign key pane when appended/removed.

Adds willShowInDocument, willHideInDocument, didShowInDocument and didHideInDocument nofication callbacks.  This allows you to do updates to the UI without needing to observe isVisible or currentState.
Tidies a la jshint.
Makes the transition API nicer to use by removing the _OUT and _IN prefixes.  Also fixes the transitions that manipulate layout to properly reset the original layout when complete.
Fixes detaching pane to call super method first before clearing the rootResponder.
Changes SC.SheetPane to use transition plugins:  17 lines added, 56 lines removed!
Publicizes _state as currentState, privatizes isRendered as _isRendered and adds Enum for current view states.
Removes unneeded code.
Adds deprecation developer warning to SC.SceneView.

Splits the transitions into their own files, which will make it possible to blacklist/whitelist them.
Improves the bounce transitions.
Adds the spring transition.
Moves aside some debug statements.
Improves the easing function for the bounce transitions.
Adds developer warnings when cancelling transitions.  This should help in debugging transitions to ensure that they are properly reversible.
Updates the statechart diagram.
Adds BOUNCE_IN/OUT and SCALE_IN/OUT transitions for SC.View.  Fixes other transitions.

Adds private _animateFrames method to animation code which will run a series of animations (i.e. frames) and fire the callback after the last animation.  This is used to create fancy animations using SC.View#animate, such as a bounce or wobble.
Fixes missing component of cancelAnimation that failed to clear pending animations, which would then appear in the next run loop.

Removes a lot of redundancy in view rendering and updating.  Previously, the update code would run applyAttributesToContext every time which would update several one shot properties: classNames, isTextSelectable, role and also update some properties that were doubly updated elsewhere: layerId, isVisible.  Now the one-shot portions are done in renderToContext, which is strictly a first time render method.
Fixes several issues with the shown and hidden substates.

Optimizes the observers on isVisible and isFirstResponder to be added when the view is attached and subsequently removed when the view is detached.
Also deprecates ariaHidden and sets it properly according to isVisible + current view state.
Adds _executeQueuedUpdates method to execute the content, layout and visibility updates when a view is about to be shown.
Moves should be unneeded code aside.
Updates the statechart diagram.
Fixes broken transitions.
Removes more unneeded code and blasts away another observer (at least for now).
Adds the transitions properties to SC.CoreView along with docs.
Tidies up to remove some unused code and fix CollectionView to match new actions.
Allows doAdopt to be called on childViews that were created with createChildView but haven't been added to the childViews array yet (i.e. not fully adopted).

Adds more explicit documentation of what happens when calling removeChild and removeAllChildren.
Adds method removeChildAndDestroy that will remove the child and discard it entirely.
Adds optimization to removeAllChildren that will clear the parent's layer in one sweep rather than per child.
Adds optimization to replaceAllChildren that will clear the parent's layer in one sweep, add the new children and create the new layer in one sweep rather than per child!

Fixes handling of doShow and doHide for views that are in queue-able states.
Allows edge of isShown states to still receive updates without forcing.
Removes unneeded callbacks for show and hide transitions (using in and out callbacks instead).
Removes the unneeded isHidden property and privatizes isHiddenBySelf and isHiddenByAncestor.
Allows destroyLayer to be called on attached views.  Fixes replaceLayer and improves docs.
Deprecates most of the visibility module, since the visibility is more accurately and efficiently maintained by the statechart now.
Deprecates paneDidAttach from SC.Pane.  SC.View already has a callback that does the same thing 'didAppendToDocument', which we should use to keep things simpler.
Fixes placement of the run loop for focus event so that code changed when makeFirstResponder runs, it runs inside of the run loop.
Tidies the SelectView.
Fixes a few panes based and deprecates paneDidAttach method.
Fixes broken transitions and allows for non-parent transitions.
Removes unused code and deprecates the buildIn/buildOut methods of SC.View.
Updates statechart to allow un-forced updates in any of the shown states.
Cleans out unneeded code in layout.js.
Adds SC.Pane statechart overrides.
Removes debugging statements from SC.View statechart.
Adds lots of jsdocs to SC.CoreView and removes all outdated code.
Deprecates SC.StaticLayout mixin.
Fixes regression with soon to be deprecated resetbuildState when appending a child.
Further corrections to SC.View statechart and major increase in unit tests for it.
Tidies and repairs unit tests, in particular a lot of tests create views without properly destroying them, thus leaving them in the DOM as other tests run.
Cleans up some unit tests to properly remove created objects, etc.
Fixes deprecated duration argument in animation tests.
Reduces the number of view states by half and significantly improves and cleans up the code.
Adds fade in, fade out, move in and move out transitions (WIP).
Integrates into new view statechart code (WIP).
Adds child view layout plugin code (WIP).
Adds child view layout plugin code (WIP).
Fixes comment typo.
Adds view statechart code and tests (WIP).
Adds new View Statechart graffle.
Removes extra observers on SC.ButtonView.

Adds debug mode only warnings if invokeOnce or invokeLast are called outside of a run loop.

I encountered a weird bug while working in the console due to the fact that invokeOnce was running after invokeNext, which will never happen in the context of the run loop.  A warning should help save developers from making similar mistakes.
Removes private unused SC.View.prototype.prepareContext method.  As the comments pointed out you should not use this method it is OLD.
Adds minor comments tidy.
TextField incorrectly sets initial isBrowserFocusable

Bumps Showcase submodule.
Updates CHANGELOG for 1.9.2 (Build tools fixes).
Updates CHANGELOG for 1.9.2.
Fixes SC.LabelView default style so that 'needsEllipsis: true' will work on single line labels.  Also added the property to the SC.LabelView class with jsdoc explaining it.
Fixes SC.browser.experimentalCSSNameFor to accept a standard CSS attribute name not a DOM style name and return the proper supported CSS attribute name.
Fixes improper binary search used by SC.ManyArray addInverseRecord that resulted in an infinite loop.  Closes #626.

Removes extra array creation.  Rather than create an array for no purpose other than for testing respondsTo when the statechart is destroyed, this change adds a gate check to the respondsTo method itself similar to what was already done with sendEvent and gotoState.

Fixes bug that allowed the context menu to appear regardless of overriding contextMenu in a view or setting SC.CONTEXT_MENU_ENABLED or isContextMenuEnabled to false.  This makes the context menu event handling behave the same as the key, mouse, etc. event handling.  Fixes #549.
Renames file to match mixin name.

Some actions need to be always handle by a TextFieldView when it has the focus

If a parentView of a TextFieldView handle deleteForward deleteBackward,
moveLeft, moveRight, selectAll, moveUp or moveDown, the event will not
be mapped to the TextFieldView.
Small fix with the method layoutChildViewsIfNeeded
Fixes the hint value for SC.LabelView so that it will appear when the label has no value and isEditable is true.  Includes unit test.
Updates CHANGELOG for 1.9.2.
Fixes regression in IE7 and IE8 which caused XHR requests to fail to notify.  Also fixes unit tests to pass in IE7+.
Fixes regression in SC.StackedView.
Deprecates old SplitView so we can move experimental version into master.
Removes long long long deprecated code in SC.store (missed from previous commit).
Removes long long long deprecated code in SC.store.

Deprecates store.loadQueryResults used for remote queries so that we can just use store.dataSourceDidFetchQuery for both local and remote queries.  All the loadQueryResults method did was set the store keys on the record array and called dataSourceDidFetchQuery anyway.  But having this extra function with a much different name is confusing for developers and requires checking if a query is local or remote before calling the matching method.  Instead, we can just call the one method dataSourceDidFetchQuery for queries and optionally pass in the storeKeys for a remote query.

Also added better documentation for using dataSourceDidFetchQuery.
Fixes failing unit tests due to throwing Error instead of message now.
Updates submodule.
Fixes the jsdoc declaration for property types throughout the framework so that they will appear in docs.sproutcore.com.  Also catches a couple @property that should have been @param
Fully deprecates the animation sub-framework, since it has been fully implemented into SC.View:animate and significantly improved.

Fixes some totally wrong documentation on SC.Query and deprecates the argument overloading in 'local' and 'remote' in favour of only passing the options hash.  This makes for:

• more memorizable methods right now

and in the future when we are able to remove the normalization code,

• less code
• easier debugging
• less chance for edge case bugs

Merge pull request #952 from nicolasbadia/throw-error

Throw Error instead of String
Throw Error instead of String

Enables live collection updating while scrolling in touch.  The touch scroll view doesn't update the vertical and horizontal scroll offsets until the touch ends, which means that the clippingFrame of the content won't update until the scroll comes to a stop.  This brings over and tidies the code in CollectionFastPath that uses the touch offset to determine the current clippingFrame and reloads the views while dragging touches.

This also deprecates willReload and didReload on SC.CollectionView because the view itself already handles all the item view and layer pooling.
Removes some unused code that didn't make it into the SC.CollectionView refactor (deemed to be unnecessary).
Makes the internal API more consistent and prevents exception when removing views and content has been nulled.
Removes debug statements and unneeded variables.
Removes old comment and improves support for transitioning from deprecated fast path.
Fixes regression in private method and simplifies internal API.
Updates to improve docs and fixes pooling.
Simulated mousedown event should include clientX & clientY.  Also prevents the test from hanging.
Cleans whitespace in collection view and removes redundant content property in SC.ListItemView (it is already defined by SC.ContentValueSupport).
Adds private (for now) method to properly move the pooled item view out of visibility when not destroying the layer.  The previous version didn't work when the number of items changed.
Commits work-in-progress on collection view pooling so that I can separate out work that should be in a different branch.
Uses SC.View as the default exampleView to avoid errors.
Tidies up the changes a bit more.

Removes SC.ListItemView as the default exampleView of SC.CollectionView.  For one, SC.CollectionView should not be used un-extended so there's no reason to predefine this value and for two, this means that you can't blacklist out SC.ListItemView and keep SC.CollectionView.
Speeds up the performance of determining if an item index is a group index in SC.CollectionView by first checking if there are group indexes and the item index is within those indexes.
Adds documentation on the new default SC.CollectionView view and layer pooling.
Deprecates useFastPath in SC.CollectionView (i.e. SC.CollectionFastPath) since the performance improvements have been baked in by default.

Refactors SC.CollectionView to implement reusable item views and view layers.  This support was built into the view already via an undocumented property, but didn't work correctly anyway.  The same support could be found in the SC.CollectionFastPath mixin, but it was also poorly documented and difficult to use.  Instead, the performance improvement has been re-implemented to be simpler than the version in SC.CFP and to actually work unlike the version in SC.CV and so that it will be seen by developers, it has been turned on by default.

- Also removes some of the problems with itemViewForContentIndex as noted by internal comments.
- Also removes the reloading benchmark, which was previously deprecated.  Removing instead, because it doesn't even work, the call to SC.Benchmark.start was invalid.
- This is a work-in-progress commit, there are more to come.  Results so far:

  on reload all:  previous version  ~14.5ms,  new version ~ 6.5ms
  on reload partial:  previous version ~ 6.39ms, new version ~1.27ms

Requesting an index beyond the length of a sparse array should not trigger an index or range request on the delegate and just returned undefined.  If you need to prime a sparse array to start loading without setting a length, it's best to use sparseArray.requestIndex(0).

includes unit test

There was an issue that if you destroyed a child view, it would destroy its
layer and remove itself from the parent, which in turn invoked updateLayerLocationIfNeeded
in parentViewDidChange.  If before updateLayerLocationIfNeeded ran a new
child was created with the same layer id, when updateLayerLocationIfNeeded
did run it would remove the new layer from the parent.

The solution was that if a view is destroyed, don't invoke updateLayerLocationIfNeeded.

- includes unit test
Fixes a problem with pooling views.  If the layerId changed, the original layerId was unknown and the original cache of the view in SC.View.views would not get removed.
Updates SC.RecordArray's pacing code to use the updated invokeNext function instead of setTimeout.

Fixes SC.Cursor's determination of its internal stylesheet object.  Previously, it would just take the last stylesheet, but any style elements in the body would match this.  Instead we find the stylesheet whose node matches the element we insert for the cursor object.

Includes unit test.
Fixes regression with label view that accepted mouseDown on double click even if it was not editable (prevented the double click from bubbling).
Updates deprecated attr() in attributeBindings internal code.  Fixes #933
Uses the doubleClick event handler rather than mouseUp since the conditional already exists in root responder.

Fix SC.LabelView inline editing

If an SC.LabelView is inside a collection view the doubleClick method
can't be call because the collection will handle the mouseDown event.

Improves and fixes the platform animation test.  Previous version was just plain not smart, new version uses a style element within the test element.  Which means that we don't have to worry about having a stylesheet to modify or having to search through the stylesheet for clean up.  Instead, the style element is scoped to the test element and when we toss out the test element it takes care of all clean up.
Fixes unit tests to pass for previous change to inline text field.
Deprecates the unused arguments in SC.InlineTextField:positionOverTargetView.
Forget to remove some obsolete code

Fix review

Review of the positionOverTargetView method after dcporter report.
Removed blurOnMouseDown which is not needed anymore.
Add support for the multiline flag.

Fix inline text field position

Since this commit:
https://github.com/sproutcore/sproutcore/commit/4d199900fcd8a60f757c10a8
2de01b5f0576a907 (which were welcome since besides fixing the z-index,
it also fix a problem where if an inline text field was in a scroll
view, the field wasn't moving when scrolling), the calculation of
position of the editor was completely wrong. This can be see in the
showcase, with the SC.LabelView and the SC.ListView examples.
Based on my app and the showcase app, this commit fix the problem. I
haven't added units test because I believe this can't be tested.
Note that I've also dropped IE7 support for this since I'm not able to
test it and because even Twitter Bootstrap will drop IE7 support in
there next release.
Fixes typo in documentation.

Adds the concept of Infinity to SC.IndexSet.  Although, the number of indexes will always be constrained to Number.MAX_SIZE, attempting to create a range even in the several hundreds of thousands would freeze the client, because it will attempt to generate hints every 256 items.  Instead we can use the concept of infinity and don't try to hint the infinite range.  For one, this allows for infinite arrays and infinite lists to be possible without using really large numbers that are very slow to hint.

Includes unit tests.
Fixes typo in test name.
Fixes typo in comment.
Fixes problem with optimization to layoutDidChange that failed to resize children if the layout lacked width & height defined.  Updates unit tests.
Prevents exception when using borderFrame property with useStaticLayout views before they have rendered.  Includes updated unit tests.
Miss that there was already a has-branch element
SC.MenuItemView: Add a right arrow when a subMenu is defined

- Fixes incorrect calculation of the borderFrame property in SC.View.  It used the wrong names for the properties and didn't work at all.
- Fixes frame failing to recompute if the border property of the layout is adjusted.  Previously, layoutDidChange only checked for changes to the width or height layout properties to indicate that the frame has changed.
- Adds unit tests that validate the frame and borderFrame when using border layouts.
- Adds _effectiveBorderFor() function, which reduces the amount of repeated code to determine the border of any particular side
- Also tidies the layout.js file a la jshint.

Fixes typo in warning message and makes SC.View:createChildViews behave as the warning indicates. If there is an invalid childView it will be ignored, which includes removing it from the childView's array so further iterations over childViews (eg. SC.View:awake) don't throw exceptions.

- Also removes unnecessary conditional around the main body of the function.
- Includes extra unit test.

Fixes memory leak in SC.MenuPane.  It failed to destroy its internal menu view and that view's child views when the menu pane was destroyed.  It also failed to remove the internal menu view reference.

Includes unit test.
Fixes bug when calling animate from within the invokeNext queue on a view that is already being animated in the same queue, but has not yet been modified.  Includes unit test.

Fixes problems with SC.MenuPane.

- it will now observe the items array for changes to its contents, so if the items array object itself doesn't change we can still update the menu items
- it no longer shares the default items array object with all instances of the menu pane
- it no longer shares the internal key equivalents hash object with all instances of the menu pane
- removes unused variables
- fully deprecates support for an items object to be an array
- improves jsdocs

Fixes SC.ScrollView's always updating scroller visibility and maximum scroll offsets.  The code was supposed to only go through the process of determining scroller visibility and dimensions when forced (due to the scroll view's frame changing or when the content's cached width and height matches the current width and height of the content).  The code assumed that the first argument would normally be undefined, but because the function is an observer method, the first argument is always the target of the observer.  Therefore, the fast path conditional would always be false.

This changes the code to instead clear out the cached content width and height before calling contentViewFrameDidChange, which will allow the code to run completely.  Subsequent calls from the observed changes will be able to exit early based on the cached values.
Adds the content view layer observer to the original content.  Previously, only when the content view changed would the new content view be observed for layer changes.
Tidies SC.ScrollView wrt jshint.  Removes several declared but unused variables.

Fixes SC.GridView's calculation of max height when its width changes.  Previously, as the grid view was compressed or expanded, the layout of the grid view (maxHeight) would not update, which meant that scroll views would not adjust their scroll heights appropriately.

This removes the computeLayout() call from the reloadIfNeeded method in SC.CollectionView.  Since only certain events should require the layout to change (i.e. itemsPerRow changes in SC.GridView, row heights change in SC.ListView or the content length changes), we don't need to repeatedly run the computeLayout code every time we scroll a little bit.

Adds adjustLayout method to SC.CollectionView which can be used with invokeOnce to adjust the view's layout when one of the previously mentioned events occurs.
Changes missing child view error to a warning, since we don't actually throw an exception.  Also pulls the warning out of production code.

Fixes regression where calling destroy on SC.ContainerView before it has had a nowShowing property would throw an exception.  This was because the internal array to clean up in destroy is lazily created.
Adds unit test highlighting regression in SC.ContainerView if destroying before setting nowShowing.
Removes z-index from SC.SelectView label for Ace.  SproutCore styles should not use z-index and it's not needed in this case either.

Add support for touch events to SC.PopupButtonView

This simply map the touchStart and touchEnd events to the mouseDown and
mouseUp methods.
I'm not sure this is testable.

Fixes bug when testing animation events, which occurred when trying to insert an animation rule into a stylesheet that started with @charset.   Instead the rule will be inserted at the end of the stylesheet and the cleanup code will start at the end and go backwards to find it.

Deprecates SC.BENCHMARK_RELOAD as a public property of SC.CollectionView.  This is a property used for developing and improving SC.CollectionView and doesn't need to be public.  It also doesn't need to be included in production code.  Anyone hacking on SC.CollectionView can add (and later remove) their own benchmarks while they are coding it.

Fixes incorrect code in SC.CollectionView reloadIfNeeded when reloading all indexes.  The previous version would check the containerView's childViews and either pool them or destroy them, which doesn't work because itemViews can be created without being a child view of the container.  So the same itemView would be created twice with the same layerId, which isn't so bad in this case, but not correct either.  As well, the "optimized" replaceAllChildren implementation is almost exactly the same as the original replaceAllChildren.  If we can really optimize replaceAllChildren by setting 'childViews' rather than appending them sequentially, why not do that in SC.View.prototype.replaceAllChildren?
Fixes regression from recent fix to SC.CollectionView which inserted replacement views in the wrong position.
Makes test descriptions unique so that which test passed/failed is easier to determine.
Cleans whitespace.
Fixes minor typos.

New Sheet pane implemented with slick animations

Removes fallback function that could possibly run too soon and incorrectly disable transition and animation support.  The fallback doesn't need to be there anyhow, because we only test for event names when we find that the matching feature exists.
Adds passing unit test to try and verify existence of issue #263.

This reverts commit a8b4645b51138894380623ec831d03b0156d7ca1.
Moves experimental SC.SplitView into regular desktop framework.  Fixes a couple problems with bindings and failing tests in the process.

Fixes debug images and test iframe.html being included in builds.  These files (one of which is 2.5MB) would get included into every build, because they were at the wrong path.  I removed the apple logo which appears unused in the tests and fixed the directory structure and file references so that 'a_sample_image.jpg' and 'iframe.html' don't get included in production builds.

Note: this is especially a problem if you wanted to create an app manifest based on the contents of the built static directory.  The client would have to download a 2.5MB debug image that is never used.
Sets SC.WebView src to '' instead of 'null' or 'undefined' when the value is null or undefined.  Removes the "No matching entry in target" message when value of SC.WebView is cleared.

Adds the inline text field to the view's parent rather than its pane.  If any view in the chain from pane to the view's parent has a zIndex, the text field won't be visible.  By adding it to the parent instead, there's a greater chance that nothing special will need to be done with the text field.
Fixes regression in layout style refactor that inserted 'center-x' and 'center-y' invalid style attributes as well as a 'border' class along with the proper 'border-width' class (each side).
Fixed unit tests.

Corrected spelling of "win" in unit tests.Fixed browser unit test to
throw errors when an expected property is simply not set.
